Reviews.Title: “The Best - book "splurge on the house"!”
Reviews.Author: Dgojen
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews both good/bad about esencia before we booked our recent day trip. march 5-9 2012. AMAZING, AMAZING, and WOW AMAZING! I must say people need to book the correct rate and communicate your needs to the staff. My husband and I are VERY picky travelers. First off, the food is perfect. my husband has diverticulitus and cant do spicy. I simpley called the hotel, spoke to the chef and he remembered the ENTIRE week about the special food issue we have. let me also break down what I found to be incorrect on tripadvisor. #1- ipods are free to borrow during your stay (not $500 as some one else mentioned) #2-prices are very resonable. $18 penna pasta, $12 main meal bowl of soup and bread, $22 french toast w/ all the sides and coffee included. I mean really, where can you go and get specially made food to your liking for great american prices. If you dont like it, tell them. they will make it right. #3 quite rooms, that are spotless.- get a plunge pool and enjoy (they arent cold, you just ask 30,min prior to use and they will warm it tright up to the requested temp of your choice) NO BUGS, they light a diffrent scented oil each nite and place near windows in your room. also on the deck the light a bug coil everynight to keep bugs away outside. you dont need to leave your bed to adjust the window blinds, tv volume, fan, ac, heat or even dimmer lights...there is a switch for it all on EACH side of the bed for him/her. #4 known by first name - everyone and i mean everyone will call you by your name. i feel bad because i couldnt remeber everyones name myself. and service is like NO WHERE ELSE. #5- they do all the extras. all the little details, they do! If you want something for gosh sakes, speak up! they will make it perfect in everyway. I smashed my hand while there and i felt like a queen. they were so caring and generally worried about my piece of mind and health. #6 beach is the best, and they wont let yo move a finger. infact everyone from the farther hotels down the beach kept trying to steal our plush towls from the basket they provide for the guest by the outside shower. 5 people were kindly asked to move off the private beach cabanas for esencia guests only, made me laugh. #7 splurge on the house - they will give you an equal credit for the value of your room each and every day you are there, meaning my room was $699 per night and EVRY day they gave us $699 to use on food, alcohol, spa service, taxi service, etc! over the whole week tax/service tips totalled $500 for two people for days. SO CHEAP for all that they do and make you feel. learn to book the correct rate for your needs and communicate with the hotel...you wont be dissappointed, promise! tell lulu, marisol, jamie, brenda, louise, the chef and everyone else The Guffey's recommended ya!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: tamiam1969
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at a hotel in Tulum and decided this time to spend the first week at Be Tulum and the second week at Esencia (they had an amazing deal called the "Splurge" which made it a very reasonable price for the luxurious stay - the "service charges" were unavoidable and quite pricy). The staff are very friendly and attentive, the spa is unlike others I have been too (in a good way), the food was diverse and reliably good, the beach was amazing, the room was spacious with all modern amenities (we even had 2 bathrooms), the pools were fresh water (one is for kids), and all requests were accomodated. We originally booked a garden/jungle plunge pool room, but after being on the beach in Tulum, I had to hear and see the ocean from our room so we upgraded and could not have been happier. The bed was comfortable, which made my husband very happy! Our room had a nice big patio with table and chairs, a day bed and a hammock, plus a georgous view of the ocean. We will be on the look out for specials again, which you can see on their website or by just calling, because we would love to go back if the price/special offer is right, so to speak. Now, a bit of information about the beach area. Esencia is not exactly in Playa del Carmen, it is south of there and located in a cove. It takes about 25 to 30 minutes to walk from one end to the other and there are a few other hotels that are operating there. You should know that there are also a few hotels/developments that are vacant and in disrepair - most are guarded so as to prevent squatters. Because the cove is small, the vacant developments do not really affect the feel of the beach. It is still quite pristine. There is one all inclusive development in the cove, but folks there stay to themselves so the beach at Esencia remains pretty private. The ocean itself is mostly shallow, quite rocky in places and reefy in others, which made swiming out a bit tricky, but take a buddy and you can manuver fine. We swam every day and had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Yucatan area of Mexico approximately fifteen times. This resort is five star in every capacity. The location is idyllic, the accommodations are luxurious, the food is excellent and the staff is beyond compare. You will not be disappointed by this choice. I literally have not one thing to complain about. If you are looking for an intimate setting for romance or a great place to bring the kids this place has the space to accomodate either and yet it feels like an intimate resort. There are mini-villas with their own pools that you can rent for a family. There are also extremely private rooms for two with their own plunge pools. We were ten minutes by cab to Puerto Adventuras for diving and other water activities or the concierge would be happy to set everything up for you. That's what really blew me away about this place. The staff is unlike anything I've experienced in my life. They were genuinely interested in whether or not we had a good time. The staff is numerous, friendly, and always happy to meet any special request or take that extra step to insure you are getting the best experience, That goes for everyone from the gardeners to the waiters to the beach staff and the concierge.

Reviews.Title: ““Amazing, truly the best hotel that I've ever stayed at.””
Reviews.Author: fionamilles76
Reviews.Content: Esencia stay is a fantastic experience and this was no exception. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment, very spacious rooms, well equipped kitchen and fantastic amenities. Service was great, attentive , friendly, professional. Food was very good. Loved it and would love to go back just to stay at the Esencia.

Reviews.Title: “Another Year Another Great Time With My Vacation Family”
Reviews.Author: EvanR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my third trip to Esencia and just can’t say enough about the great ten days I had. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave you are treated like you are in a friend’s home. It is not just a marketing slogan on the hotels part it is part of the mindset. From not seeing a bill for 10 ten days to always being address by first name it is the perfect way to spend some quiet time. Some observations for people considering visiting Esencia for the first time though: * The resort is not designed for Children over the age of 4 or 5. Meaning there are no organized activities, the pools are not meant to be used for ball playing or doing cannonballs into. Therefore, please keep in mind that if you are bringing children to the resort that most of the other guests selected this resort to have complete relaxation and not be disturbed. If you are planning on visiting during an American School break be prepared for this type of behavior as they hotel went overnight from a private oasis to a hotel that had a population of 25% children.. * While the service at the spa is great you will notice an inconsistency in the same treatment if provided by different people during your stay. One time you get a feature in a treatment and then next time a different worker does not included the same feature. * All rooms are great but if you enjoy sitting outside at your room do not spend the extra money for Ocean view/Ocean Suite as those terraces are smaller and do not affoard the privacy of the Garden Suites. * As the resort only has 29 rooms their is only one dinning option for Breakfast/ Lunch and One option for dinner. Therefore, if yo like a lot of variety this resort might not work for you as Playa Del Carmen is a 20-minute ride via cab and costs I believe $25. HOWEVER, an advantage of the small size of the resort is Chef Bernardo and his team will make you any variation of a dish using what they have in the kitchen. His seafood Paella and Tuna Fillet are amazing items that are not on the menu. * Now to the Staff of the property they are they true winners of the resort. From Lillianna in reception/ congierge to Oswaldo on the beach and the entire waiter team (espcially Fidel, Louis, Juan, and Clemintino). They are all very hardworking individuals who deserve the reconiztion as they remember your personal preferences and will converse with you anytime you want or work in stealth mode at other times. With all of these observations, I look forward to my next trip back and cannot wait to see all our friends again.

Reviews.Title: “An Esencia Wedding and Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn W
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding and honeymoon at Esencia last July and could not have imagined how perfect and wonderful it was. I will start my review with my wedding planning process by saying “Every bride needs a Brenda”. Brenda Espinosa is the wedding coordinator at Esencia, and she is absolutely incredible. She takes care of every detail, no matter how small, with such diligence and care you would think she was planning her own wedding. She had a lot on her plate, dealing with a three night wedding event for me and my 75 guests, but she did it all with a smile on her face. Brenda always ends her conversations with “No Worries!”, and with her help planning, there definitely were not any. “No worries” is a great lead in to my experience at Esencia for my wedding. It was truly a dream come true. Between the casual luxury of each event (welcome cocktail party, rehearsal dinner, wedding & reception), and the exceptional staff, me and my guests were actually able to relax and enjoy each other. I never had to worry about a thing…seriously. How many brides can say that? I cannot think of words to do the staff justice on their exceptional job for my wedding weekend. All I can do is say THANK YOU for making it truly the best three days of my life. Now for the review of our stay at Esencia; it was truly an escape to paradise. Here are a few examples of how Esencia goes above and beyond for their guests: they present you with a bottle of wine from their vineyard when you check in (and it is delicious!), every morning you wake up to coffe/tea/danish on your patio to enjoy, breakfast is included in your stay and it is NOT to be missed as it is amazing, tea and cookies are served in the main house in the late afternoon, and complimentary yoga takes place in the morning. The staff at Esencia is second to none. They know you by name, not room number, and they become your friends while you are there (yet they know exactly when you need to be left alone to relax!). Omar and Fidel, Lane and I still talk about how much we enjoyed you on our stay! The restaurants are incredible; I must reinforce my previous statement: do not miss the complimentary breakfast! Chef Bernardo and team, you made our culinary experience, both for our wedding and our stay there, one we will never forget! The Spa is unforgettable; they grow their own herbs and make their own oils. Getting a treatment while you are there is a must! If you are trying to get away from it all, avoid crows and large resorts, and find a place where you and your family can escape, Esencia is it. It is such a personalized experience, that you feel like a house guest. Lane and I plan to return to Esencia as often as we can, and will never go anywhere else in Mexico. Why would you? Thank you to everyone at Hotel Esencia for all that you did for us! We love you! Evie and Lane Wood

Reviews.Title: “everything is perfect”
Reviews.Author: jonasstun
Reviews.Content: The Hotel resort was spotless & very comfortable with everything we needed. Stunning views and leafy. Very accommodating. Great customer services. Friendly staffs and polite. The rooms are ridiculously clean and spacious. It gives you the feeling of being in a luxury!. The pool area was open and spacious with a large free-form pool and a fabulous ocean. Definitely will visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Breakfast on the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: OliveOilandLemons
Reviews.Content: A leisurely breakfast is the ultimate luxury and we have made quite an art of the breakfast ritual, wherever in the world we are. While on the Mayan Riviera we frequent a few places that add an element of luxury or authenticity (sometimes both) to our Mexican experience. I thought I'd share some of them with you without (hopefully) writing a tome about it. But, you never know. I'll start with hotel Esencia and may submit some more entries later. Here it goes: Hotel Esencia on Xpu-Ha beach A former private retreat of an Italian Dutchess of the Ferrari family (so the story goes), this exquisite 29 room hotel is situated on the gorgeous stretch of Xpu-Ha beach south of Playa del Carmen and a couple of miles south of Puerto Aventuras. Reservations for breakfast are required as the property is gated and a guard at the gate must have your name on the list to let you through. Once through the first gate you reach the second gate at the welcoming palapa where you park your car, leaving the keys with the guard and get a ride on a golf cart to the main house of the hotel. The ride through the jungle is interesting during the day and beautiful at night, with low lights lining the narrow path. I don't know how they keep these jungles clear over such a large area. Once at the main building you are led into the reception office where they ask you to leave a visa imprint with them (to guarantee payment I guess) and then you are escorted to the restaurant by the pool in front of the beach. Some of these formalities are sometimes waved because we have become regulars, but the visa imprint is always taken. I ceased to be offended by it as this is their custom and the experience is worth it. The breakfast (and lunch) restaurant is served at the poolside pavilion situated right off the gorgeous beach beside the pool and it is beautiful. The staff speaks English (we practice our Spanish) and the food and service are high end. The tables are covered with white cloth and are shaded by a roof. It's airy and bright and the view of the pool, the beautiful grounds, white sandy beach and turquoise waters beyond is simply breathtaking. Breakfast is pure luxury. The menu offers local specialties and the more familiar International selections. Chilaquilles with fried eggs, juevos rancheros, grilled poblano with scrambles eggs and chorizo and Mexican scrambles eggs are offered along with poached eggs in artichoke heart with foamy hollandaise (exquisite) , waffles, French toast and more. You can see the menu on their website.The coffee they serve is premium brand Cafe Koba from the Chiapas region, one of the best coffee sources in Mexico. It has a full flavour and is served freshly brewed in a French press in one or four cup presses. The milk is hot (that's how we like it) and it's fun sitting with a cup at the end of breakfast planning the rest of the day. We always follow breakfast with a long beach walk and a swim at either end of Xpu-Ha. The water is usually lovely for swimming and the whole experience memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: totally nice, lovely, we liked too much and would try to come back soon. fancy, delicious and peaceful

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Place to Pull Up A Chair and Forget The World”
Reviews.Author: lgaynor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all the best places in the area including Mandarin Oriental, Rosewood, Maroma (our favorite), Paradisio, so we were intrigued to try Esencia. We love small resorts that we don't have to leave and offer personalized service. Upon arrival, there are no flaming arches announcing the resort, instead you pull into a private road where you are met by an Esencia employee. You are then taken by golf cart to the main house where you check in (awkward process) and receive a glass of lemonade. You get a quick tour of the resort which is quick because the resort is so small but perfect sized. The suites are OK. Very little storage space, no drawers and the windows don't open in the bedroom area. Great view of the ocean, nice rain shower and balcony. Loaded iPod music is nice touch, fresh fruit replenished daily and a welcome bottle of wine was included. There are two pools. The adult pool is seldom used but perfect if the water was a bit warmer. The kids pool is literally right across, a bit smaller and a bit warmer. Unfortunately, the restaurant for breakfast and lunch is located in this area. And yes, this place is not for kids and luckily, they have no kids camp, no kids activities and kids anything. But we did see kids daily. The beach is beautiful and the lounge chairs are covered by individual hatched areas although some are very close together. Beach service is spotty but effective. Ocean is not roped off and has plenty of dangerous rocky areas which was surprising. But no seaweed, perfect 1.5 mile of sandy stretch and a few downtrodden and abandoned resorts along the way. We spent each day at the beach and loved it. The main restaurant open for dinner offers a broad menu and the fresh fish is done very well. The chef, Bernardo, is friendly and will accomodate your requests but speaks little English so be patient. Good wine list and moderately priced. Breakfast is typical assortment of dishes, they can update their fruit and oatmeal quality. Lunch is outstanding. The spa is very nice and they offer any type of treatment, massages recommended. Stay away from salon services. Nice changing area, steam and assorted whirlpool baths with varied temperatures. No amenities so if using the shower area, you have to bring your own toiletries. This needs to be updated. Bad news: No gym. First luxury resort with no gym we have encountered. I have no idea what guests do when it rains. There is yoga offered at 8AM but the area is right in front of guest rooms and hidden from the beach. Staff is very friendly and after a few days, remembers your requests. They will do most anything for you, just be a little patient at times. Management is typically not present and Philip makes it to the resort about once a week. Their take on Esencia is that they want to be like living in your own home so they don't want to bother the guests, have anything with their logo on it and even go to the point of not having bathroom signs indicating men or women. The main house has a living room area, small library, TV and WIFI (no WIFI in the room but they can arrange for it). There are no lounges or bars to hang out, afternoon tea seemed popular. Most guests were European and languages varied across the board. If you want to do nothing like we do, this is a great place to visit. We never left the resort and loved it. The food is varied enough so you don't get tired of it either. Note that there is a one hour drive from Cancun airport and you will need private transportation.

Reviews.Title: “For our purposes, give it a 10/10”
Reviews.Author: JM9439
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Esencia in January '12 and had the perfect time. I would recommend this property to any couples looking to literally remove themselves from the world for however long they wish. Personally, three days/nights feels like the perfect amount of time here - you have the ability to leave the property, but you won't want to. This experienced epitomized a relaxing 'beach vacation' - the rooms are great...private, clean, comfortable etc. Service couldn't have been better - almost seemed as if there were five visible hotel employees for every one guest. The food is perfect (can pretty much order whatever you want) - but again, to the earlier point about three nights being a solid duration, you're eating at the same restaurant/from the same menu unless you leave the property (25 mins to the town)...so good to be mindful that a week at this hotel, for us, would have felt drawn out. We felt that after three nights, we left at the peak of our time there...which turns out to be a great feeling. The beach couldn't be better/more private...and the spa serves it's purpose. You fly into Cancun and it's ~45mins to the hotel, which goes by quickly. The hotel certainly makes you feel at home - as advertised. We'd 100% go back, even before trying a new spot - and another thing I'd look to do is bring 5-10 couples out there for a vacation - I could see that being a great time. Shout out to Fidel (#1) and Juan...oh, and make sure you try the Clase Azul tequila. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall small, classy hotel but could make improvements”
Reviews.Author: itunu
Reviews.Content: We could not decide whether to stay esencia or tides (now called viceroy) so stayed at both.  The rooms at tides are much nicer because you have a whole villa and plunge pool. The ocean view suite at esencia does have a view of the ocean but you can't see the ocean as trees are in the way. There is no gym - you can pay $20 to use the Catalonia hotel's gym. Esencia have free weights you can use in your room but they are only 4 pounds in weight.  The person who showed us around when we checked in was ok but we didn't get the welcome we got at Tides and he also forgot a couple of things we asked him to bring to the room.  The restaurant is good though and the beach is more private and nicer (no rocks) than the one at Tides.  Esencia give you free coffee to your room between 7-9am and free tea and cookies in the main building between 4-5pm which are nice welcoming touches. You don't get a bill after every meal and they instead send a bill to your room every 2 days but this doesn't have a breakdown of what you actually ate - just totals of the cost of each meal. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Esencia - is not perfect but very nice, especially if you want a small, classy place.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to relax...great spa”
Reviews.Author: mskatymay
Reviews.Content: You can read my comments on the hotel location in Google maps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Peace”
Reviews.Author: GWCmaya
Reviews.Content: A really beautiful spot on a coast that has sadly been spoilt in many places and which is just far enough away from Cancun. This is not a place for the hyperactive but you will be extremely well looked after by the charming staff. Great service as you lounge on the beach which is all of 5 metres from the pool. The rooms are stylish but minimalist in decor and comfortable. The food is good but perhaps a bit same-y after a few nights. The Spa is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much last March we went back in October. Everything about this place is beautiful & peaceful & delicious.”
Reviews.Author: Indimama
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with his hotel & have told many, many friends & family members to go & i can't wait to go back. it's a piece of heaven -- it's NOT a scene so its not for people looking to meet other singles & party hard - it's a quiet place to lay on the beach, snorkel, chill, eat, drink, be pampered. The spa is so lovely -- The staff are so happy-I was told by 5 or 6 of them that they "don't consider it work." I think this place wouldn't appeal to someone looking for a 5star big hotel type of deal - its like staying at a private estate & you are treated like an old friend. I've traveled a heap & this is my new favorite spot. It's such a close trip from the east coast --

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bandwannabe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel through Groupon but would love to go back at full price. Working in the hotel industry for 12 years now, I've been exposed to a number of properties at many different levels of luxury. This hotel really surprised us. Fantastic service, clean rooms, and most everyone knew our name as we walked the property. This is a great property for a private relaxing time in the Mayan Riviera. Internet access is missing in the rooms (actually quite a relief). Access in the bar does not carry over to the beach, so you're limited to the lobby and pool bar. The morning coffee and tea delivery was delightful and seemed to delay breakfast for most guests until around 9. The restaurants served very good food and the chef and servers were incredibly helpful with my wife's food allergies. We had ZERO issues with her allergies and the chef custom made each of her meals to eliminate the allergens. We had a great time on the beach, but beware of the rocks immediately off the beach by the hotel. Go further into the cove to get better access to the water. My only potentially negative comments are that the hotel does not have many of the amenities (gym or in-room internet) that many hotels have, but it just forced us to actually relax and unplug from our digital world.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: dml479
Reviews.Content: I don't give 5 stars quickly, but Esencia deserves them. It's an amazing, beautiful, top notch hotel. The staff are courteous. The rooms are beautiful. Anything you need is catered to, and quickly. It's quiet, but not dead. The restaurant is fantastic - the ceviche,the lobster sandwich, the dinners are all great. The beach is perfect, clean, and beautiful. Plunge pools are amazing, I had a chance to see one of the giant house/rooms and it's ridiculous as well. Amazing. Really I wish I could be more descriptive, but superlatives pretty much sum it all up. If you want to spend some money on a hotel, you could do much worse than Esencia.

Reviews.Title: “relax, beach and good food”
Reviews.Author: elewalsh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful stylish hotel, full of original details and with a very good vibe. We spent at Esencia 5 nights and we did not want to leave this hotel. Staff is attentive , professional and helpul, they could not do anything more for us.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: ajleadon4080
Reviews.Content: Esencia is not an "all inclusive" resort which means it may not be as economical as some other options in the area. However, you get what you pay for and what you get with Esencia is a completely unique and luxurious vacation experience. When we arrived, we were greeted with a delicious cocktail, given a tour of the property, and shown to our room. There was fresh fruit and a bottle of wine waiting for us! In the mornings, the staff would leave coffee, tea, and little pastries/baked goods outside our door. We had an iPod in our room preloaded with some fun music. Also, the mini fridge in our room was always stocked with bottled water. Just a lot of nice touches! The staff is professional, inviting, but never overbearing. The chef at Esencia is a genius. My husband and I loved the food so much, we actually cancelled a snorkeling excursion so we could spend our money on more fabulous meals! You can taste how fresh everything is; not to mention, freshly squeezed juice in the mornings...and in my margaritas! Worth it. Speaking of snorkeling, Escencia can provide you with snorkeling gear (at no cost)! My husband and I went everyday - just hopped in the ocean and swam out! There's a reef with lots of sea life no more than 50 yards out. The grounds are spectacular, the staff is incredibly kind, the beach is pristine, and the food....the food is AMAZING. Our room was sleek, modern, and clean. It was such a relaxing and intimate experience; we felt completely pampered the entire time. My husband and I didn't want to leave and we're already saving up to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “an amazing escape”
Reviews.Author: anjleen
Reviews.Content: escencia is a beautiful isolated resort with amazing beaches! it is the perfect place to get away from it all and relax. only cons were that the food is a bit pricey and weren't much options and there were mosquitos at night - i assume that is the true with all other resorts though too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazzzingg!!”
Reviews.Author: Mirna R
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that once we arrived at esencia i was worried because of how different it was. Once we were taken to the main entrance of the Hotel i was in total awe. Esencia is soooo beautiful our room was amazing and soo clean. We were there for 4 nights and those 4 nights were simply amazing. The staff at Esencia were so wonderful they made you feel like at home. I want to thank everyone at Esencia for making this trip unforgettable. Thanks to patricia and the concierge team. To the great Chef who i didn't have the pleasure of meeting :( miss the Camarones al tamarindo (Great dish! must try) Thank you Henry and Fidel for taking time to have a conversation with us and making us feel like at home with good friends. Thanks Esencia we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: kimcreolSL
Reviews.Content: We were there two nights. I would not change a thing. The room was always clean and comfortable. We slept 12 hours on the comfortable bed. We will definetly return. Beautiful place!! This hotel was Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “5 wonderful days”
Reviews.Author: bernardettecuad
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days during our honeymoon and it was a wonderfu stay. The service was excellent, everyone was very pleasant and their for you. As soon as you arrive you are told to relax you are on vacation. They take care of all of your vacation needs with a smile. NO PRESSURE NO PROBLEM is not only a very tasty drink it is what they express as a daily sentiment. Everything was wonderful!!!!! If you get a chance go go go !!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sigmay55
Reviews.Content: Esencia is one of the best place i ever been. I'm glad we choosen it for our last days in Mexico. Everything was perfect, service, staff, room, beach, massage.........we could not ask for more !!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: annabellabrick
Reviews.Content: Great place and great staff. My boyfriend and i had one of the most relaxing trips of our lives. Staff is extremely attentive and friendly. They always seem to be right there when you need them. Highly reccomended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't get food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller500
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a lovely setting. Do not expect the extras you might get at a Four Seasons, but instead there is a more intimate feeling to the property. Unfortunately my wife and I suffered from very bad food poisoning whilst staying at the hotel, having been there for a number of days when we were struck down. This ruined the experience and our perception of the hotel. It would have of course been improved had the hotel recognised that this had significantly impeded on our stay, but alas not. I am sure anyone will have a great stay here if they are well, but watch out!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful place with amazing peole”
Reviews.Author: ttalbert21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Esencia for our honeymoon in July and it was everything we wanted and more. We wanted to eat, relax, lay out on the beach and drink amazing margaritas and that was exactly what we did. The staff: Everyone there is so incredibly nice and helpful. Although the restaurant choice is limited, the chef (Samuel) will prepare anything you want. And if you don't like it, he'll try again (and is happy to do so). The concierge will do their best to plan whatever trip you want and give you the best advice on surrounding areas. While laying out by the pool or at the beach, whatever you may need, someone will bring it to you. I can't say enough positive things about the people who work at Esencia - they were amazing! The hotel/beach: So beautiful! We stayed in one of the garden suites and it was perfect. We had our own plunge pool (which they cleaned out daily), our own porch area, and a beautiful room. The rooms are simple and white with few decorations, but this adds to the serene and calm feeling. And I have never seen such a beautiful beach. The water was so blue and clear and the sand was so white. You could see straight through the water and there wasn't even anything on the sand in the ocean - it was so pristine. The food/drinks: Delicious! Samuel was amazing and there wasn't anything that we disliked. And the margaritas were my favorite! They were so simple but so yummy. I had one everyday. The spa: Unlike any experience I've ever had. They incorporate Mayan traditions into everything that they do, from the clothes they wear to the ritual they do to start the massage. And the hot tubs are open to the outdoors, which makes you feel like a part of nature - so cool! Overall, I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for somewhere calm and relaxing. It is a place that is very "tranquilo" with incredibly nice people. We loved it and hope to go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: ebesner
Reviews.Content: After much research, I selected Esencia for a week of solo decompression on the Mayan Riviera. The goal: get away from work physically and mentally, turn off all devices, head to the beach, catch up on reading. In essence, to just UNPLUG from the stress of the city grind. I could not have chosen better. The estate property is impeccable, verdant and extremely well maintained; the staff is as helpful yet unobtrusive as I've encountered anywhere; the meals are gourmet and deliciously local; and the indigenous creatures strolling the grounds (peahens, sweet gekkos, friendly if skittish iguanas) are as happy to be residing there as they should be. The resort succeeded in making me feel like I was a beloved visiting friend of the family at an exclusive tropical estate, rather than a booked-in guest. I would -- and will -- return.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, quiet, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mgherrington
Reviews.Content: Far away from the Vegas-style large resorts, this tucked-away paradise offers a peaceful retreat. The views were stunning. The property is beautiful and a joy to walk through each day to breakfast, the beach or the main house for a cocktail on the veranda. The staff was superb and accommodating. The suites offer great privacy. A wonderful respite for busy executives - Mary Grace and Rick Des Moines, Iowa

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise...”
Reviews.Author: DKozl
Reviews.Content: Early this year my girlfriend let me know she had booked a vacation for us at a small little resort south of Playa del Carmen.. the pictures and website looked amazing but I can say upon returning the photos do not do the property justice. From the moment we arrived at the front gate we both felt at ease and relaxed. Our tour of the property was thorough but not overly long and drawn out.. For the next 5 days we spent our time doing absolutely nothing but enjoying the beach and pool, as well as a fantastic couples massage at the Spa. The service we received throughout the trip was absolutely stellar from the towel service through the very responsive concierge services. Taking the cooking "class" with Chef Garcia was alot of fun, educational, and provided the 2 of us a fantastic lunch and plenty of snacks for the beach that afternoon. We've been back about 2 weeks and still speak of how amazing the vacation was, and how we definitely will return to our little slice of paradise. Darren and Alicia

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: psctravel
Reviews.Content: After reading through hundreds of trip advisor comments on resorts throughout the Mexican Riviera, I was so happy to find the Esencia Estate. All the comments were so positive and very helpful in planning a family vacation for my father, brother, his 2 children, ages 4 and 10, my husband and myself. We were all meeting there to celebrate my father’s 70th birthday. It wasn’t easy finding a resort that could satisfy each of us however this beautiful resort did just that. If you can afford it, I highly recommend the Torre Room which is where my husband and I stayed. It has a 360-degree view with a terrace overlooking the ocean. Each morning we would receive coffee and fresh pastries delivered to our veranda by the front door and it was a perfect beginning to each day in paradise. The staff was so friendly and very helpful no matter where we were within the resort. Prior to arriving, I had corresponded with Estella in the concierge office and she was so helpful in helping me plan our vacation. I had wanted to hire a photographer to take photos to celebrate my father’s birthday and she had made amazing recommendations. We hired Rachel with La Luna Photographers and we could not be happier with our pictures. I was apprehensive about there not being a kids club, however, both of my brother’s children are still talking about their vacation there…they both have said it was their best vacation ever and they keep asking my father when are they going back! I had enjoyed services in their spa and Massages with Erica was the best I have ever had. I strongly suggest you give her a try☺. Thanks again for a wonderful vacation, Esencia, and we are looking forward to seeing you all again. Best wishes, Paula and Andrew Cook

Reviews.Title: “Loved every moment of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0sGat0s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Esencia during the first week of May and I should say really loved everything about the place! 1) The Location. It's easy to find (we rented a car and drove there by ourselves), the concierge provided us with the detailed driving instructions and map by e-mail prior to our arrival. It's very conveniently located approx. 1,5hrs from Cancun airport, 25 min. from Playa del Carmen, 30 min. to Tulum, 2hrs to Cichen Itza and minutes away from numerous cenotas surrounding the hotel! From the hotel parking lot you're taken by buggy car to your room - this drive through the rain forest takes another minute or two. 2) The Premises. It's gorgeous! The villas are nestled in the lush garden (or more accurately a manicured rain forest) full of various birds, iguanas and local animals, all harmless though)) We stayed at the Garden view suite - a spacious room decorated in local style which has a bath tub, inside and outside shower, walk-in wardrobe, safe box, porch in front entrance and small back yard with a plunge pool. The mini bar in the room is free and refilled daily. The drinking water is free as well. Wi-fi is available in the main house but if you bring your laptop you can connect in your room via cable (also provided for free). There are 2 swimming pools in front of the main building: one is for adults only, the other one is for families with kids. The hotel is family-friendly but those who travel without kids shouldn't bother - it's very unlikely that anything will distract you. 3) The Beach. It's truly amazing! It's very clean, the sand is white and smooth, and the water is turquoise. We were afraid of the rocks and sea weeds, and I should mention that there is a rock right in front of the entrance, but the beach is miles long, so if you walk 60 ft to the right or to the left you won't meet any difficulties entering the sea. As for the weeds I beleive the tides may bring some, although we haven't seen any. There are no water sport activites (for those who are interested) but the beachboy will set up sun beds in a cabana for you and you can order some drinks or snacks from the restaurant, so it's total relaxation) or you can take a stroll along the beach - there're some other properties along the beach as well, but most of them look abandoned, so you have to share the beach only with the small hotel next to Esencia (but they do have its own beach cabanas and restaurant). 4) The food. The most exciting thing was fresh pastry and brewed coffee or tea that is delivered to your room every morning before the breakfast. I gained several pounds, but it was worth it!)) The breakfast is a la carte but it's included in the room rate (It's served from 7am to 10 am, after that time it's charged to your account). The poolside restaurant is open from early morning till dinner time, and the main restaurant is open for dinner only. The food is gourmet and you don't really want to go somewhere else to eat. 5) The SPA. I guess we tried everything that SPA could offer and I highly recommend it to everyone. They blend the natural ingredients for each treatment individually, so even if you have a sensitive skin give it a try) 6) The Service. It was really exceptional. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. They met and exceeded all our expectations. Almost everybody spoke good English so we didn't have any communication problems. 7) Overall Experience. This is a place for those seeking for luxury and calm. The Mayan Rivera is quite expensive part of Yucatan Peninsula. If you're planning to hang out outside the hotel a lot, it's reasonable to rent a car. In my opinion the hotel is a couples/families destination not singles/friends one (it's only my opinion though). Can't think of anything else at the moment, would be glad to answer any questions))

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MLG21
Reviews.Content: Today is the last day of our 8-day honeymoon here at Esencia and we loved every moment of our experience so much we just had to write about it. From the minute you step into Esencia, you feel like you are transported to a magical, peaceful, otherworldly locale. After you drive through the gates, you enter into a small, rustic Mayan hut smelling of wonderful incense and from there, you are driven in a small golf cart through a maze of tropical trees and foilage to reach the main property. The estate is nothing short of breathtaking (was a former home of an Italian duchess) and feels less like a hotel than a private, lush, incredibly luxurious and expansive home. Yes, it is pricey but it is a high end luxury resort and you certainly get what you pay for. We'd recommend checking out the website Luxury Link --- we found a great package for 7 nights on that site that included daily breakfast, a 3 course meal at the hotel's gourmet restaurant, a bottle of wine upon arrival and 2 one-hour spa treatments. ROOMS - There are ocean view rooms and garden view rooms and while we were initially interested in switching to an ocean view, we immediately fell in love with the garden view rooms. The hotel concierge told us that they often find that couples end up preferring the garden rooms to the ocean ones because compared to the ocean view rooms which are exposed at 360 degrees to the main restaurant/pool/beach, the garden rooms are incredibly private and you feel like you are nested in a beautiful treehouse (ask for a second floor room if you can get it). Our room came with a lovely patio deck and a plunge pool with a magnificent, unobstructed view of the expansive greenery. The bed is plush and very comfortable --- great sheets. We loved the homey touches: the iPod pre-programmed with an awesome playlist of music, the complimentary, automatically replenished bowls of fresh fruit and the fridge of beer, juice and water, the candle and scented oil that was burned every night at turndown. Every morning we awoke to a fresh basket of delicious pastries and a pot of coffee placed out on our patio. Perfection. FOOD - We are big foodies who were very concerned about our daily fare and the Esencia definitely did not disappoint. The breakfast (after your snack of pastries and coffee) at the restaurant is fabulous --- lots of wonderful authentic Mexican breakfast dishes that were to die for (we loved the breakfast Chile Relleno and Moltoleno Eggs!). Having gotten complimentary breakfast with our package, we expected something like a simple Continental every morning but we were pleasantly mistaken --- we got a full gourmet breakfast every morning gratis and loved it! The lunch menu is similarly fabulous (great cochinita pibil (braised pork tacos) and seafood dishes). And dinner....the formal restaurant only open in the evening is Sal Y Fuego and is absolutely wonderful. We were afraid of getting sick of dining at the place for so many nights but found something new and delicious on the menu every evening. The focus is on fresh seafood with a Mexican/Mayan twist and the food was really, REALLY good. We stepped into town in both Playa del Carmen and Tulum a few nights for meals and yet found the food at the Esencia superb to everything else we tried. Really --- not much of a reason to leave the resort! BEACH/POOL - The resort is situated right on the beautiful white sand beach and every day we had was spent nestled under one of the thatched palapas. It was incredible. The ocean is crystal clear and gentle. The two pools are lovely too but with the beach right there, it's hard to resist! We took a snorkel tour from our beach out a mile or so (ask the concierge to set you up with the tour guide, Lucas, he is fabulous) and it was incredible. SPA - The Aroma Spa was so wonderful we made multiple visits on top of our complimentary services included in our package. The spa experience here is unlike any other spa we've tried --- it incorporates a lot of unique Mayan traditions and has a very spiritual, holistic approach. For instance, before our massages, we were asked to stand on a mat, holding hands with our eyes closed with two women carrying bowls of smoking "koba" leaves danced the smoke around us. It is supposed to release any toxins from our being. The massages were fabulous (I loved the "kukumis" treatment of aloe and cucumber for sunburnt skin) and ended with a plunge in a private hot tub set up for us. Would not miss the Spa during your trip --- very special. SERVICE - Everyone at the Esencia is incredibly friendly and knows your name; it was amazing how attentive they were of our needs and how in tune they already were with who we were, what we liked, what we didn't like, etc. We joked it was almost like being in "The Truman Show" because it seemed that everyone knew us so well. The concierge was very helpful --- they arranged snorkel tours and a tour to the Dos Ojos cenotes for us (not to be missed; we loved the cenotes). They also arranged for our private airport transfers (about $100 for a private car from Cancun to Esencia/about an hour drive). We contemplated renting a car at one point but realized we didn't really need it as we spent so much time on the property and getting a cab when going out was so easily facilitated by the concierge. In sum, the Esencia is truly not to be missed. It is a gem in an area of Mexico that is oversaturated with huge, impersonal resorts with thousands of rooms stacked on top of each other. The Esencia -- with its 29 rooms -- is truly worth it; a real place to get away from it all!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!-That's what we call a vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: prsmke
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive to Esencia you feel connected with nature and Mayan culture. Service incredible and they accommodate to whatever needs you have. Don't forget to try the Ceviche Verde!! The food is excellent!!- This is the best hotel we've been at!! We stayed at a suite with private plunge pool, that was great!! The landscape is very well design, so it feels really private and you're surrounded by nature, nice trees and flowers.- As the name of the hotel is Esencia (essence) nothing like getting into your room and have great aromas, same to sit at the front porch in the evenings.. the oil essences just add such a great touch of relaxation. - We'll probably rent a car next time, since driving is pretty easy and roads are very good. However, Esencia was great in getting us the transportation airport-hotel, taxi to go to Playa del Carmen and Hotel-Cancun. I had a different image of downtown Playa del Carmen, it was kind of disappointing, it is very commercialized already. 5th ave is quite long to walk, there are a lot of restaurants but stores are not as unique as I thought they would be. Beach is nice but nothing compared to Esencia's beach front. We took the tour with Carlos Antonio Hotow Diaz, highly recommended!! you can take your time and experience authentic food. We did Chichen Itza, Coba and Ikal (Cenote)- he was very professional and Rafael our guide in Chichen Itza was "substantial". Now that it is forbidden to climb there, you definitely want to do it in Coba, it gives you a different perspective and dimension of those constructions besides the amazing view when you're on top of it!! It was our first time in Mexico, so we didn't go to Xcaret but for sure we will check it out next time, specially the night show was highly recommended to us. Instead we stayed in Cancun the last couple nights and even we knew it was too commercial, after being at Esencia was a tough transition. All those all included places are suitable for most people but we rather have the option to experience the places we're at, Esencia definitely provided that. If you're looking to party and drink all they long, Esencia might not be your place. If you're looking for a paradise to relax, to drink wine or a cold bear under the sun while enjoying an amazing beach or a private plunge pool... then Esencia has it all!!- I forgot to mention the Spa is incredible!! We will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical! We got married here!”
Reviews.Author: stelhunt
Reviews.Content: This place is so magical and beautiful that my fiance and I decided we absolutely had to get married while we were there on our trip. We ended up doing a wedding on the beach at Esencia and we will never forget how perfect it was and how the spa and staff made it so special. Brenda was absolutely amazing in making our last minute wedding day so romantic and memorable from start to finish. She took such pride it making it wonderful for us and we loved her so much we wanted her in the wedding!:) The property is pristine, smells like fresh herbs everywhere and the grounds are perfectly manicured. The food is delicious, and the staff is so wonderful, attentive, and respectful. We really enjoyed everyone who worked there. They do not miss a detail in making this place so luxurious and comfortable. Its a relaxing place to enjoy it's lush surroundings, white beach and clear blue sea. Nothing feels commercial about this place, it is a classy, romantic estate. Highlights: coffee and pastries waiting at your door every morning when you awake, amazing music on the ipod they leave in the room for you, a different essential oil burning in your room every night before you go to bed, the best margaritas ever, the most comfortable beds ever, adorable palapas by the beach, gourmet food, insane spa, everything else! We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. I cannot wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferRPascal
Reviews.Content: Start to finish - we loved this vacation. We stayed in July 2008. We never left the property - we talked about it with some other guests and they said they had tried it and there was really no reason. We loved the restaurant, we loved eating in our little palapa on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful get away with the friedliest stafff and beautiful intimate surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: lilyclaudette
Reviews.Content: this was our third time at Esencia and it was better than ever. the setting is gorgeous, the staff is unbelievable and the beach is lovely. This time, i took my eight year old daughter who had asked to go again..while there is no kids club, there is plenty to do in the surrounding area and also plenty to enjoy at esencia...the beautiful gardens, the pool, beach and great food. the spa is beautiful and the massages i received this time were terrific. the staff will always accomodate any request. This special place is for people who love small stand out places with great service and lovely accomodations. Alexa( New York City)

Reviews.Title: “What a let down.”
Reviews.Author: pcspclst
Reviews.Content: This place was such a total rip off from the BUG infested rooms to the Overpriced food. We felt we were trapped there. We were pretty well stuck paying ridiculous prices for food drink and darn near everything you would want or need on a vacation. I pretty much gave up drinking because the drinks were so bad and so expensive (I would recommend bringing your own beer). Since it is a destination Resort, there aren't any other restaurants or other food options available. It takes 30-45 minutes and $25-$30 dollar taxi ride to go to Play Del Carmen. A simple lunch was well over $100 US for pool side dining and dinner was well over $200 US. On top of that, I found a FLY in my salad, when I told the waiter he said he would remove the fly ... how disgusting is that. I got sick from the food on the 3rd day and stayed in the room (toilet) for 3 days. The room was another issue although it seemed clean, when I awoke the second day I had bed bug bites all over my legs and private areas, OMG! FYI: "OFF" does work to rid yourself of more bed bug bits. As I walked out the door each morning to get ripped off for breakfast. I was met with the foul odor of sewer, I guess the staff is used to that smell they seemed to be used to it. The trip was to be a relaxing Beach/Spa destination, My massage was not even close to what I was expecting, in a word it was "bad", however in true Esencia style it was very expensive and once again a rip off. If you are considering staying at Esencia (Spanish for rip me off) I would strongly suggest you think three times about it and go some where else. I have stayed over 10 times in the Playa area and never had this Bad of accommodation any where. Run for you life!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel....”
Reviews.Author: jannic188064
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel with a great atmosphere and super-friendly staff. We (= two spoilt and adventurous Europeans) loved it and will definitely return. We first stayed in an Ocean view suite and then changed to the Torre Suite. Both of them were impeccable and so was the SPA and the Food! Due to the size of the rooms the place is crowded with families. There were a few children running wild and we would not recommend the place to couples that look for quite days on the beach...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: twbluesky
Reviews.Content: Hotel Esencia is a beautiful, quiet paradise. The beach is uncrowded and the water pale blue. It is a hotel for recharging and relaxing, not for partying all night and making lots of noise. Sitting in the cabanas by the beach, sitting at the pool, enjoying tea at casa principal, delicious meals......the pace is slow, the service is wonderful. When we went to the Mayan Riviera we tried several different hotels. When we got to one of the others, we did everything we could to get out of our reservation so we could return to essencia instead. The spa treatments are not to be missed and yoga is wonderful every morning in the yoga pavillion with gentle breezes and waves softly lapping the shore. For those seeking more activity, there is kiteboarding further down the beach. We can't say enough good things about essencia! Our entire family enjoyed it ages 6-50. And...we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hotel Esencia”
Reviews.Author: alkibizzio
Reviews.Content: The moment you enter the little Maya house, entrance to the Esencia estate, you feel an immediate change. A sense of serenity comes over you & increases  as you deepen into the property. The healthy, thick vegetation & the aromas from the flowers & plants inebriate you and you close the world behind.                                            You are attended by a staff that is warm, available, discrete and  very professional making you feel totally welcome and at home. The accommodations are outstanding spacious, clean and equiped with an external plunge pool that heats up when you decide to go in! The stars look really terrific from that angle...   No detail is ignored including finding coffee, tea & pastries outside your room by 6:30 am so that if you are en early riser while you read, listen to the chirping of the birds and the sound of the waves breaking against the shore you can enjoy a cup of coffee & munch on sweets before you go to breakfast. Or finding different aromas burning on your night table to help you have a better rest. Or beach personnel bringing cold towels on the hot beach to help you cool off a bit.  And  many more courtesies. The SPA is absolutely wonderful, nothing more calming, soothing, relaxing and spiritual. The food...gourmet cuisine both international & traditional Mexican. The Evening Menu is not very extensive and there’s no good restaurants very near, however the chef will prepare whatever food you desire -- so you can't go wrong. Anything you need or want to do is promptly provided/organized by the staff and this is a real commodity especially if you want to rally, or go sightseeing, or go diving, etc. -- Paradises such as Esencia, need to be a little bit isolated.  I would like to suggest to the Management of Esencia to take into consideration a health club area that presently is not available and I also strongly recommend improving the WiFi coverage. Personally I was very happy to be out of touch but my husband has clients who don’t appreciate his being unreachable. Be that as it may, the charm of Esencia conquers you and as the days go by you feel yourself revived and become a brand new person!  Our days in Esencia were among the best and memorable vacations my husband and I have ever take.                                    We are thrilled with our stay and want to thank & congratulate everybody working in Esencia for making our stay "heavenly"!

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking paradise!”
Reviews.Author: gdrennen
Reviews.Content: Esencia was amazing and we thoroughly enjoued our recent stay there! The grounds are breath taking and instantly you feel like you have been transported to a different world. There is still the lingering feel of a different era combined with a lush, tropical aura. As a private estate in the 1920s, we felt like we were staying at someone's amazing private residence. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful and overall the resort was extremely well appointed. The water is stunning - electric blue with white sandy beaches and there was never an issue of not getting a spot on the beach - plenty of chairs and cabanas for all guests. The food was also great - we especially enjoyed breakfast! French pressed coffee was to die for! We also enjoyed the coffee and breakfast rolls left in our room each morning - they leave it in a nifty cabinet on the patio. Just watch out for the birds as they tend to steal the rolls! Overall - anyone looking to escape in the lap of true luxury would love Esencia. The resort is a quiet sanctuary that provides a real escape and the personal touches are great. Fromt he moment you arrive, you are greeted by their friendly staff and taken around the resort. "Checking" in is a 5 minute process if that as they offer you freshly made lemonade ata table outside looking out at the water. AMAZING! One thing to note with traveling to/from resort - like most resorts in this region, a taxi to/from downtown Playa Del Carmen is about $20 plus tip, so approx. $50 RT. It is worthwhile to go downtown at least one night or 2, however it does get pricey adding in the cab. It evens out to about the same money spent whether you stay atthe resort for dinner (which is very very good) or go out.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place I've ever stayed in my life (and I'm a picky New Yorker).”
Reviews.Author: Littlelotte617
Reviews.Content: O.K., let me put it to you straight. Esencia is amazing. I came here for a week with my boyfriend, and we couldn't have been happier with the service and personal touches. They bring you pastries and coffee every morning and put the goodies in a cute little cupboard on your patio to keep them fresh and away from the birds. Birds, you ask? Yes, birds. You are in the jungle. I put our leftovers back outside this morning (... just trying to help), and my boyfriend saw a bird fly away with an entire pastry in his mouth. The staff have an amazing way of making sure you are taken care of without hovering over you. I am a vegetarian (my boyfriend is an English carnivore), but the chef Bernardo made sure my needs were met and made special dishes for me. Breakfast is amazing (and included). They bring you coffee in a French press! Even if you aren't a breakfast person, try it out. Seriously, practically everything comes with asparagus or a side of awesome. Here's what's great about Esencia. The week we were there, the hotel was full, but it never felt that way. It's the perfect mix between having enough people so you don't feel like you're alone in the Mexican jungle and being *just enough alone* so that you don't get annoyed searching for an empty chaiselounge or cabanna made out of straw. (Yes, they are made out of straw.) They have a separate pool for children in case you are like us and don't have them and want to admire them from afar but have your own space. They also have a repertoire of DVDs that you can borrow for free! My boyfriend just rented us "The Reader" and "Vicky Christina Barcelona." In terms of improvement (I have to list a few things because there's always room for improvement), there isn't wi-fi everywhere. We are sort of psycho New Yorkers who are unable to unplug, so it would have been nice to take the laptop to the bed to check news and whatnot on occasion. (Seriously, we came here and the Middle East blew up.) They did give us an Internet cable, so we could check e-mail/Internet from the desk. It's also difficult to socialize, in a way. There isn't a pool bar or anywhere to congregate between lunch and dinner. I think the resort could benefit from a bar near the pool where people could chat and whatnot. That said, there is a lovely lounge connected to the restaurant, which is open at dinner, and my boyfriend and I saddled up for some nice evening cocktails. (Again, New Yorkers.) I have read that some people think the food is expensive, but I have to say that's part of vacationing at a luxury resort. My boyfriend and I would split lunch sometimes and were a little cautious of our spending, but I wouldn't say that prices were overly exorbitant. Breakfast is included, and you are treated to fruit throughout the day. In sum, everyone is just absolutely lovely and genuinely happy to take care of you. Isn't this what you want on a holiday? It's what we wanted, and we couldn't have been happier. We will be back. (Or I hope we will be back. Please, honey?)

Reviews.Title: “relaxtion.....”
Reviews.Author: jfobjr
Reviews.Content: Great place and great staff. My wife and i had one of the most relaxing trips of our lives. Staff is extremely attentive. They always seem to be right there when you need another margarita or beer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: NosParks
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Esencia - the beach is fantastic, the facilities are clean, the atmosphere is tranquil, the food and drinks are delicious, and the service is above and beyond. Claudia was a wonderful host, and went out of her way to accommodate each and every request we made. The waitstaff was excellent and so friendly -- our 11-month-old daughter fell in love with them. (Obvious note: if you want to really relax on a beach vacation, you may want to consider leaving your baby with the grandparents!). When beach time was over, we especially enjoyed our heated plunge pool. We strongly recommend Esencia for a beautiful and relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “heaven. don't know what else to say.”
Reviews.Author: davespc
Reviews.Content: this was my wife's and my first vaca in 30 years. When we first got there we were nervous there would be nothing to do and that was the case. the four days just flew by, sitting on the beach, walking up and down the beach, relaxing and being waited on by a wonderful staff. The food was phenominal. At our first meal I asked the server to make sure there was no black pepper on my fish. from that moment every waiter knew "no pepper for senior David' we will for sure be back in way less than 30 years. by the way, if you do want to actually do something the staff will gladly arrange it for you. just a fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: rjb1104
Reviews.Content: Esencia is an absolutely amazing resort. The resort is quiet, unique, gorgeous, and luxurious. The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. The resort is different than most luxury hotels in that it is quite, quaint, and subtle. We stayed in a garden-suite room with a plunge pool. The room was quiet, spacious, and clean. They provide you with an ipod with pre-programed songs and a surround sound system. The bed is incredibly comfortable. They also provide Molton Brown bathroom products..which is always a plus. The food was truly amazing. They also offer afternoon tea and cookies...such a nice treat. We are very spoiled to have great food in nyc, however, the food at esencia was some of the best that we have ever had. The yoga in the morning is wonderful as well..there is nothing better than doing yoga while looking at the ocean. We also utilized the spa..which is very unique and incredible. Aside from all of the wonderful aspects of esencia, it is definitely a family friendly resort. There were several families there with small children....so don't expect an adults-only environment. However, the children were well-behaved and fairly quiet. Additionally, they mostly play in the childrens pool. The best part of the resort has to be the staff. They are all truly incredible! They are always looking to accomodate you and better your stay. The staff deserves a huge applause because they make your stay even more memorable! The staff are so friendly, sweet, likeable, and outgoing. If you are looking for a luxurious, small, quiet, beautiful, and relaxing get away, esenia is the place for you! We will definitely be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomdc
Reviews.Content: Esencia is the epitome of a luxury hotel without the airs of other resorts in its class. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we felt completely taken care of by a gracious, welcoming, willing staff - and in such a gorgeous, lush setting. True paradise! The food was incredible (and we are foodies!) the beach was lovely, rooms minimal and perfectly appointed. The spa was such a welcome retreat - much needed and lovely. We also booked a day trip to view the ruins at Tulum, such a great cultural experience mixed in with our beach time. We loved every minute at Esencia and would recommend it (and have!) to anyone who is looking for a glimpse of paradise in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: Kbw511
Reviews.Content: Spent a week alone, painting, reading and enjoying the beach. The yoga every morning was fantastic. Celebrated my 50th birthday. Enjoyed a different ceviche every day on the beach! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant sanctuary on an over-developed coast”
Reviews.Author: Finnbar
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have stressed, this is a gem of a hotel, all the more valuable since mile after mile of the coast in both directions seems to consist of a dual-carriageway with entrances leading off to one vast development after another. These unattractive surroundings may be part of the reason why guests stay put, as well as the many virtues of the hotel itself. The lay-out has been well-planned. Once inside the gates, the grounds are long and narrow, with only a limited beach frontage; most of the rooms have no sea view, and from the ones nearer the entrance you can hear the traffic, albeit some way off. Nevertheless, the prevailing atmosphere is one of calm; the grounds are beautifully done,the two pools are very pretty,and the paths are lit at night to give the desired romantic look. It is a huge piece of good fortune [for the Esencia guests] that the hotel to the north was put out of business by a hurricane, so that about a kilometre of beach, right to the northern end, is unoccupied.It's a good beach, not the most idyllic, but fine cool sand [not the sort that burns the soles of your feet] gently shelving into the turquoise water. It contains no beach hawkers, nor did we see any motorised watersports, so it is delightfully easy to let the whole day slip by in peaceful idleness. There are lots of nice small touches which have been mentioned elsewhere [great bathrooms, afternoon tea, book and DVD repositories, iced flannels, pre-breakfast tea/coffee and pastries,] all of which we enjoyed. We were not sold on the pleasures of swimming in the ruined hotel's cenote; what we were shown was not a cenote at all, but a small natural harbour at the sea point. It was slippery to enter and exit, and the fish were not amazing in type or volume. However the walk to the inlet was interesting, like a scene from a post-apocalypse movie. Because of the short days in the tropics there is an in-between hour or so before dinner, too dark for the beach, too early to eat. Maybe everyone else was beautifying themselves for dinner, and we were the only ones who would have liked to sit with a drink looking at the sky and perhaps the sea [it does get windy after dark], but the restaurant bar was indoors and lacking the panache of the other facilities. Perhaps as a result it was very under-used. The restaurant itself is charming, excellent food and service. Finally, all of the staff at the Esencia were wonderfully helpful - particular thanks to Juan and Fidel and the beach butlers - and extremely efficient. We particularly liked the ease with which we could consult someone in the concierge's room about anything, at any time, and the way they exerted themselves to make things happen the way we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “understated, comfortable with a sense of being in a private home Esencia is an ideal place to recharge ones batteries”
Reviews.Author: regentspark17
Reviews.Content: small, comfortable, in an idylic setting Esencia is the complete opposite of a resort complex. like being in a private home it is very comfortably decorated, not lavish but warm and inviting. A good place to recharge ones batteries if one wants peace and quiet. Spa treatments were excellent - different from european ones. Would not enjoy being there though with bad weather as one is far from anything of interest. Staff were very hospitable and nothing was too much trouble. food was also very good and the kitchen would prepar anything that one asked for that was not on menu. Airport on arrival was chaotic and the driver had to wait outside in a crowd of people. Takes approx 75 minutes to drive to hotel but on arrival - was like an oasis. 8 days flew past doing very little but relaxing, and in a way were glad there was no gym. Just went for walks along the beach. Can reccommend it highly if one enjoys tranquillity.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Airhostess85
Reviews.Content: Esencia is an absolute gem. This is the antithesis to the 'Ritz-Carlton' type experience. The service is personal, attentive and gracious - every need (or whim) is addressed swiftly, but with calm composure. The hotel and the grounds are just beautiful, tastefully blending modern design with natural elements, local history and culture. Furthermore, a feeling of peace and tranquility is, somehow, all pervasive here, as if a magical Mayan relaxation spell has been cast upon the entire estate. A very special place, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, yet welcoming & relaxed”
Reviews.Author: skyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Esencia is a wonderful hotel. Amazing beach, welcoming staff, great food, great rooms. In a lifetime of traveling around this globe, it is truly one of the nicest places that I have come across.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time and still an oasis”
Reviews.Author: Bauerfamily
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Esencia 3 years in a row and every year we love it. It has become the place we go to recharge our batteries to start the new year. We chose Esencia because it is a small luxury hotel with all the things we adults enjoy but is family friendly. We tend to stay away from the all inclusive resorts. The Mayan Riviera offers enough culture and adventure for the entire family. Every year we leave having made new friends who we remain close to. We think Esencia is the best vacation for our family and worth the cost. It never surprises us that most of the other couples and family are returning guests. The entire property is beautiful. The staff delivers great service. The concierge can satisfy your every need. The food is great. The yoga classes are an added plus.The location is perfect (about 1 hour from the airport) 20 minutes to Playa del carmen and within 15 minutes to most kid friendly adventure parks and about 40 minutes to the Tulum Ruins. We snorkel in the nearby reef and use their diving services to explore more areas. Best of all the nanny on call is a blessing while we dine or use the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip”
Reviews.Author: newyork68
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what to say about our stay at Esencia other than that I literally can not wait to return. This property and its lovely staff have managed to make luxury effortless. We have been to many '5 star' resorts, and many of those have indeed been very nice. But there is almost always an air of pretention, or a feeling a being nickel and dimed, or at best, the feeling that we've left a beautiful resort much like many of the other resorts we've stayed in. Esencia, on the other hand, has no match. It is relaxed and easy - the staff appear to genuinely care about everything they are doing, and you need, the food is fantastic and the chef is incredibly accommodating, the property itself is spotless and beautiful, and the beach is fantastic. In addition, we were traveling with our 1 year old son and every effort was made to ensure his comfort as well. I could go on and on - but basically, don't think twice about staying at Esencia. Any other place you are considering is probably nowhere near as wonderful as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Solosport
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This was one of the most relaxing vacations in my history of travel. I have never felt more relaxed more quickly (within a few hours after arrival at Esencia) and never have I gone home feeling ready to take on the world again, than here. Everything others have commented on (the good stuff) is true. For us, there were no con's to this place. Others have commented at times on the food choices/diversity. We could not be more satisfied with every meal and our kudos go to the chefs a thousand times over, even if we are adventurous foodies. We wouldn't ask them to change a thing. The service in the restaurant, room, beach, and poolside was impeccable, timely, and unbelievably kind. We will remember our new friends Omar, Henry, and Fidel who served us, among several others, so graciously. The rooms, the aromas in the evening, the breakfast pastries delivered with coffee to our porch, the heated plunge pool for the evening or mornings. And finally the spa. Oh the spa! We had a spa treatment each at the spa as part of our package. The best experience I have ever had, with their Mayan techniques and ritual. We even experienced the Temezcal on or last afternoon. Quite a treat. We will be back, hopefully very soon. Our one wish while we were there in December. The evenings were cool and we wished the resort had a small fire pit to sit around in the evening, maybe with a small bar at which to meet new friends or have another romantic moment. You would never regret choosing Esencia!

Reviews.Title: “No words can express how lovely Esencia is.”
Reviews.Author: ChristinePhoto
Reviews.Content: I booked Esencia as an anniversary getaway for my husband and I and I am still having a hard time returning to the real world a week later! I am counting down the days until we can visit again and heck... maybe move! lol From the moment we arrived, it was pure bliss. From the attentive staff to the scenery, I was in love! I am not a fan of huge resorts and wanted a little private getaway, but it was far better then I could have imagined! The room was stunning, spotless and always well stocked with water,soda,etc. The food was top notch and the service to match. I highly recommend Escenia. Truly a private Eden!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever, just unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: StevenHertsUK
Reviews.Content: We're lucky enough to have stayed in some amazing hotels over the past 10 or 12 years but this tops the lot. Beautiful location, stunning rooms, superlative service and wonderful food. We'd discuss what type of food we fancied during the morning and had simply left it to the chef, he never let us down. Nothing was too much trouble, from organising trips to special events and entertainment. We don't have the words to express how amazing the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most incredible resort experiences I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: LesG_10
Reviews.Content: The website is understated. Everything about Esencia is magnificent. Gorgeous beach, amazing gourmet food, excellent spa (try Erica for deep massage), lovely rooms, houses and grounds and over the top service. Concierges Estella and Nicholas unbelievably efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Effortless Beachside Luxury”
Reviews.Author: W4Traveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend Esencia enough. Myself and my wife stayed for 4 nights and had to be dragged away. It truly felt like a home from home. All the staff were wonderful! You could really tell that they all loved the place and were very proud of this little oasis. The Aroma Spa is simply out of this world. I'm currently stuck in the snow and freezing weather of Edinburgh.......I have drifted off to my "happy place" - sat in the hot baths at Aroma - a few times over the last few days. The food was superb! Breakfast; Lunch and Dinner equally great. The lobster wrap and Esencia omelette are especially recommended. Chef Bernardo is also a a very impressive chocolate sculptor! The waiters were simply fantastic. They felt like friends by the time we left. They were great for local recommendations too, including the eerie deserted hotel next door. Ask the concierge for a pass to let you into the grounds. We very much look forward to returning to Esencia soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Resort - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: pds2010
