Reviews.Content: -despite a $180 taxi fee you have to carry your own bags at the airport....... -few of the staff spoke English, not acceptable for a 5 Star resort -no gym or fitness centre -our room flooded when the drain backed up and some of our belongings were ruined -on more than one occasion there was no running water in the public bathrooms off the pool and a toilet was backed up for over 24 hours. very unpleasant -despite both of us cleaning our teeth with bottled water and ONLY eating at the hotel we both experienced "Monte-Zumas Revenge" which in one case would only clear up with anti-biotics. -while the beach was lovely and pristine, being surrounded by ruined and failed hotels took away from the a beauty of the location This is not a fine resort

Reviews.Title: “Secluded, Indulgent, Luxury”
Reviews.Author: seebeforeigo
Reviews.Content: After a hectic sight seeing trip around Mexico there can be fewer better places to crash out and relax than Esencia. This small exclusive hotel on the lovely Kantenah Beach is almost perfect. It small with only 32 rooms built mainly as two room, two storey detached units in the grounds. The rooms have a large terrace and are beautifully decorated inside in modern style with all the modern A/V equipment as well as a complimentary mini bar. The en suite includes a spacious walkin wardrobe, a large bath and a very spacious shower cubicle, again with all the contemporary modern fittings you would expect. The icing on the cake for us was our own secluded decking area with sunbeds and its own plunge pool. The restaurant offers an excellent and varied menu for all three meals and complimentary tea or coffee and pastries are brought to your terrace at 7.30am every morning. The beach is white sand and the facilities there are excellent and there are also two pools with an extensive number of comfortable sun beds. To cap it all the the staff were without exception excellent and very friendly. Its a great place to relax after a trip or for a special occasion, honeymoon etc. Its certainly not cheap but for this level of exclusivity and luxury we believe we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: apareja
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from spending 8 days at Esencia, and we are totally impressed, from the location of the hotel, the service, the food, the room, the spa, the scuba diving&snorkeling trip, the beach, the weather, everything has been incredible, a dream come true! One of the highlights of our trip was visiting the abandoned hotel next to Esencia and swiming in its private beach/lagoon, as mentioned in another Esencia review, truly impressive! Do not miss the lobster wrap as well, I had one for lunch everyday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Low-Key, quiet honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: HouseObsession
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Esencia for our honeymoon. We stayed for 7 days, and had an amazing time there! We purchased a package via LuxuryLink.com which was great and saved a bunch on the room rates. (Our package included 7 nights in a garden suite with private plunge pool, dinner one night, breakfast everyday, one 60 min spa treatment each, and welcome basket.) First, I want to highly recommend LuxuryLink. It helped us to afford a place we otherwise wouldn't have been able to...and their service was great. Pros for Esencia: 1. Gorgeous hotel and grounds. Definitely THE BEST in the area. We walked the beach and felt like we were truly getting the best experience. The rooms were impeccable, beautiful, and relaxing...and air conditioned! We loved staying in our room just relaxing in our private pool! 2. Bed & Sheets. So comfy. My husband wanted to bring the pillows home with him. I'd love to know where they bought them! 3. The Aroma Spa. Don't even THINK about staying here without going to that spa at least twice (or more if you can afford it)!! We had one spa treatment included with our package and loved it so much, that we splurged for another right before we left. The "Cuatro Elements" and "Lx Chel" massages were out of this world. (Especially the Lx Chel.) They are way more than just a massage. The essential oils, incense ritual, steam room, cold jacuzzi, and relaxation station that come with the massage are priceless, and included in the cost. I seriously wanted to bring those ladies home with me because every one of them was serenity personified. 4. Staff. The wait staff at the restaurant was so wonderful and began to feel like friends by the end of our stay. There were so few people staying at the resort that we spent a lot of time chatting with them by the pool, etc. It was a great time, and they had good recommendations about places to go in Playa, etc. Also the concierge service was super helpful. We had an incident with our car, and they helped to resolve it and made sure that it didn't ruin our honeymoon. 5. Overall low-key quiet. This place is SMALL. And we were there during the off-season so there were only about 8 rooms filled of the 26. It felt like we were at our own private resort. Very few people eating in the restaurant with us or on the beach with us. Dreamy. 6. Private plunge pool. I already mentioned it, but we loved it so much that it deserved it's own call-out. 7. The other 2 hotel pools. Lovely. 8. Ceviche. OUTSTANDING. Neutral: 1. The beach itself. It was GREAT for snorkeling and the water was very clear. The water was warm. But almost immediately in the ocean begins a coral reef, which is really hard on your feet/body if you get tossed around in the surf. I kept wishing I had water shoes. Otherwise, the beach was quiet, beautiful and relaxing. So MOSTLY a positive, actually. 2. Overall food at Esencia. Breakfast was very good, with some options being better than others. (Chilequiles, Chile Relleno, and the French Toast were our favorites.) Lunch was amazing every single day. Those ceviches were to die for, and each one was worth trying, as previously mentioned. The dinner menu was not our favorite at all though. We struggled to find things we liked as much as the lunch menu. After about 3-4 days we began to fill limited though. (I guess that's what you get for going to a small resort though.) We finally realized that we could order lunch items at dinner when our time was almost up. Also, the food pricing was strange (and slightly high for some items we thought). It made no sense why a salad would cost as much as a dinner entree...and a burger. There weren't the normal pricing tiers that you expect at most restaurants. We ended up going out to Playa del Carmen a few nights for food. The desserts were amazing though. Definitely try those if you don't mind the extra calories. Cons: 1. Outside the resort isn't so pretty. That's what you get for choosing Mexico though. It's not Hawaii after all. 2. Children are allowed. We're not the kind of people that dislike having children around. In fact, for the first 6 days of our stay there was a couple with one child that was very low-key and quiet. It was great. However, near the end of a stay a large group showed up with about 6-7 kids in tow. Even though Esencia is kid-friendly, it's not a "kids" resort by any stretch, and it seemed weird to us that these people would choose this resort. The kids were loud, and so were their parents. We were glad that they weren't there the entire time, or we might have had a different honeymoon experience. (That being said, I will give props to the hotel for really trying to keep kids out of certain areas such as the spa and the "grown-up" pool. Kids can have spa treatments in their room if the parents want to get them...which is pretty cool. That helped create a buffer zone where at least we weren't right there with them often. It was mostly noticeable in the dining room.) A few suggestions: 1. Plan a snorkeling trip to the coral reef with Lucas. He's an awesome guy, takes photos for you, and we had a blast!!! 2. Use the hotel-provided snorkeling gear just hanging out in the ocean by yourself. It made my frustration with the coral near the beach not as bad. I wish I'd realized they had snorkel gear for guests to use earlier than I did. 3. Ask for Taida to do a massage. They were all great, but both my husband and I agree that she was particularly talented. 4. Park in a parking garage if you go to Playa del Carmen. Our rental car was broken into while we were there buying souvenirs, and my husband's phone was stolen. (He accidentally left it inside between the seats.) We had to pay for the broken glass and a new phone. 5. Utilize the concierge at the hotel as much as possible for your planned outings. We wished we'd used them more b/c our best outings were via their guides. 6. There's an old resort down the beach that is basically abandoned called La Espuja. If you ask the concierge at Esencia, you can get a security pass to go explore it. There is a private lagoon on that property that you can swim in. It was soooo cool, and felt like we were on a movie set. Loved every moment of that, and glad we asked questions to the wait staff about it.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Luxury . . .”
Reviews.Author: btpla
Reviews.Content: Esencia is a pristine, laid-back, yet luxurious vacation spot for people who like quiet, intimate hotels. The management, the staff, the spa, the beach, the grounds, the rooms were all fantastic. The food was mostly very good; we especially liked the breakfasts and fabulous Ceviche menu at lunch. We enjoyed the hotel's dinner restaurant, Sal Y Fuego and the rotating musical performers, but like some of the other reviewers, we wished there was another, more casual option for dinner some nights. The manager obviously listened to his guests, as we just learned they've added 2 casual nights of poolside dining. Problem solved! Older children and teens might be bored, but our 3 year old had the time of his life. There were no other children during our stay, but the waiters were very cute with him. Babysitting was arranged as needed. The concierge couldn't have been more helpful. We had some electrical problems in our room one day that required several hours of repair. The manager, Philip, gave us a complimentary lunch to help make it up to us. The Sous Chef actually sought us out to see if there was anything special we'd like and made us beautiful lobsters our last day. I wish there were more hotels like this!

Reviews.Title: “Sun kissed, spoiled, and happy”
Reviews.Author: alphaprs26
Reviews.Content: The staff was lovely, extremely helpful and totally accommodating, service was impeccable in every way. Beautiful setting, beautiful beach. The room and facilities felt luxurious but tasteful, elegant. I wan to make a special remark about the food, because I am vegan and was concerned that my options might be limited, but the kitchen far exceeded my expectations in this regard, going out of their way to accommodate me with fresh suggestions at every meal, and preparing a vegan special for me every night. It could easily have been a redundant menu of rice, beans and avocado (which I LOVE, don't get me wrong), but every evening I was treated to something new, equally imaginative and delicious. Among these delights was the best portabella mushroom I've ever had, by far. I don't even particularly like portabellas, but by the time it was offered (our third night, I think) the chef had earned my total faith, and did not let me down. Just a gorgeous, tender little mushroom. Outstanding! And every night was like this, just thrilling food. While the food was a pleasant surprise worth particular note, the quality of service it represents was characteristic of every aspect of our stay. I've never been more satisfied by my stay anywhere than I was with Esencia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: dhcalloway
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Esencia as part of a large group for a wedding. The hotel was AMAZING. It is so different from the other huge, mega-resorts in the region. First off, it's completely unmarked, and very private. The resort is also very quiet and calm, in spite of the fact that the hotel was completely sold out with wedding guests - which as you probably know, wedding groups have a tendency to get a little wild. Esencia's strongest quality is its service. I would barely turn my head at the pool and someone would come over to ask if I needed anything. The staff learns your name within a day, and will try and get you anything you ask for. A waiter went and picked a coconut off a tree and served it because one of the other guests expressed an interest in trying fresh coconut milk! The food was also incredible. The best guacamole I have ever eaten (and I grew up in Los Angeles, so I've eaten a lot of guacamole in my life). I didn't have a bad meal there the entire trip. The drinks are excellent as well, you can tell the margaritas are made with freshly squeezed lime juice. The hotel itself is very beautiful, very white-washed and minimal. Every morning they deliver freshly baked pastries and coffee to your room, and every night they light herbal inscence on the patio with a little card explaining the mayan use of the herb (mint for cleansing, etc.). I really can't say enough nice things about this hotel. True, it is very expensive, but if you can afford it, completely worth it. I will definitely be going back at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: gsully224
Reviews.Content: Almost every good thing has been said about Esencia on TripAdvisor. Bet let me tell you - all the praise is deserved! My one week stay at Esencia was a trip to complete paradise. Yes, it was pricey all around, but if you are traveling on a tight budget this is definitely not the place for you. Even though it was an expensive week, I would definitely do it all over again. The service at Esencia is the best I have ever experienced. When you first arrive at the hotel, you drive up to a small Mayan hut (it sounds rustic, but it's very beautiful). Right as we got out of our car, we were greeted by several workers who introduced themselves and shook hands with us. After quickly checking in, our luggage was whisked away and my family boarded a golf cart which drove down to where the main area of the hotel is. Once we got there, another worker greeted us and took us on a walking tour of the resort's grounds, spa, pools, and finally to our room. It was great - when we got to our room, the iPod stereo system was turned on and playing relaxing music and minutes later the concierge sent up complimentary cocktails for the adults and (kiddie)cocktails for the kids. Everyday at Esencia is special. After several days of eating at the hotel's restaurants (which are actually quite good) the waitstaff really got to know our family; towards the end of the trip many of the workers even knew the kids' names. One of my favorite things that the hotel did was every morning, pastries and coffee/tea/hot cocoa would be delivered to your room (again, complimentary). We were able to schedule a specific time for the food to arrive. It was great to wake up and eat croissants on our private balcony. Some of the little details really added up to make this a great trip. For example, the concierge office has a huge DVD selection. You can rent any of the movies for as long as you want at no charge at all. Here's a tip: many of the movies are in Spanish. However, if the movie was originally recorded in English, you can always change the language back to English through the DVD menu on TV. Right off the main lobby, there is a small library with a good selection of books and magazines that you can read for free during your trip. There's one more point I would like to stress: some people have complained that the dinner menu was way too limited and consisted mainly of seafood. There is no need to worry about this! At Esencia, we were able to ask for just about anything in particular to meet our dietary requests. One member of my family was particularly picky about what she would eat (pretty much only chicken). However, the waiters were extremely accommodating and the chef was ready to specially prepare any dish to please her. Bottom line: Esencia is an amazing resort that words cannot describe. I would recommend it 100%!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful small resort with amazing service and food”
Reviews.Author: camden78
Reviews.Content: I travelled here in December and it was very quiet. We had the hotel practically to ourselves. The food was great, all fresh ingredients and lots of fruit and vegetables. The beach is beautiful. Other establishments on the beach do not keep their part as pristine but the esencia section is lovely and the small beach cabins are great with waiters who bring you drinks and refresh your towels if you go into the water. THe weather at that time of year was also perfect, great sun with a nice breeze. We were upgraded to La Rosa is it was my birthday and it really made our holiday. La Rosa is the best room in the house; it is very spacious and as a plunge pool on the balcony, large well-stocked bathroom and a walk in wardrobe. We got a deal called the splurge which gave us a set amount of credit each day to spend in the spa or restaurant. This was a good idea as you knew how much you holiday would cost. We only went over the set amount one day when I went overboard in the spa (which is great also). I would definitely go back here again it was the perfect holiday.

Reviews.Title: “perfect family escape”
Reviews.Author: dcwellsmd
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 days at Esencia at Xpu Ha with my wife and 3 children ages 12, 9, and 5. Was nervous before arriving because we had done our last 2 beach vacations at the Ritz Cayman and Half Moon Jamaica, two large resorts with lots of stuff for kids. Heard about Esencia when researching Rosewood and Banyan Tree Mayakoba online, and reviews indicated that it was child friendly. Esencia exceeded our expectations. It is, quite simply, the best experience we have had at any resort, and we have stayed at "the best" for many years. We stayed at a 2 bedroom cottage, which was beautiful. Expensive, but in terms of prior villas at Ritz and other brands in the Caribbean, it delivered value. The grounds were beautiful and were maintained immaculately. The pools and beach were beautiful. The beach was nicer than any we have visited, including Cayman, the Grenadines, Barbados, Jamaica, and many locations in Mexico. What set Esencia apart, though, was the food and service. The food was excellent, especially the ceviche. For kids, the chef will pretty much do whatever you want. They catered to our younger children's needs no matter what was was requested. The drinks were also excellent, especially the margarita and mojito. Breakfast was outstanding and varied. The setting for breakfast was beautiful. The service, at all levels, was outstanding. This was especially true of the restaurant/bar service and the beach service. The Ritz chain (Naples and Cayman in the past year) pales in comparison. This is what sets the resort apart, and by a lot. We especially appreciated the attention of Juan and Elias. The kids, in spite of no "kid's club" or high tech kids stuff, all said that it had been their best vacation, and they are fortunate to vacation a lot. In short, in spite of my reservations about a small luxury resort being good for kids, and visiting Mexico in light of current events, this place was outstanding. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Kami9191
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a terrific 4 night stay at Esencia. My husband and I traveled with another couple to Esencia for my birthday. The rooms, service, and hotel was absolutely amazing. 100% top-notch. I agree with my fellow travelers that the food/drinks/services are all over priced. Its unfortunate because it really is such an amazing place but definitely something to keep in mind when you are booking. We spent close to $1200 in 4 days (and we ate off the property for 2 dinners!). But, if you've got money to burn, this is definitely the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Relax at a Cost”
Reviews.Author: Travelblondie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an amazing week stay. We went for one last adult vacation before our baby arrives. I was 6 months pregnant at the time. The rooms and facilities are beautiful, quiet and comfortable. The service is incredibly attentive. There is plenty of shaded areas on the beach and around the pool. The hotel feels very remote. It is on a quiet stretch of beach. The nearest open hotel is at least a half mile away. We usually have very active vacations and I was nervous about exercise options without a gym but there were plenty! There were yoga classes every morning at 8am. The beach is around a mile and a half long so there and back is a good three mile jog or walk. The pool is often empty and can easily be used for laps and even the unheated pool was a good temperature for laps in March. We booked a private trip through the hotel to Chichen Itza which is a two and a half hour drive. It is exhausting but worth the schlep. The hotel charged us over $500 which was a bit steep. In hindsight, we should have booked a cab for the day and hired a guide on site. It would have been half the price. The one downside of the hotel is the lack of restaurant options and the prices of the food offered. There is only one café open for breakfast and lunch and another for dinner. It is a $20 cab ride each way to the nearest town which is very touristy. The food is very good and the chef will prepare anything you request but the prices are quite steep (in line with expensive new york city restaurants). We tried to plan our meals strategically. Since breakfast was included , we either had a big late lunch and light dinner or skipped lunch and had a big dinner. Otherwise, the hotel was a perfect place to get away and forget about the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but the price of food, drink and services is extortionate”
Reviews.Author: Monica29
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from our honeymoon at the end of which we spent 6 nights at Esencia Hotel. We arrived at Escencia after 10 nights in Ecuador and The Galapagos Islands, which had been fabulous. Our first impressions of Esencia did not disappoint. The complex was quiet and very private. Our room was luxurious. The photographs on Escencia's website are accurate. We had a Garden Suite with a plunge pool. The room was spotlessly clean. The bed was large, comfortable and had a luxurious duvet and pillows and the bathroom was beautiful with a double vanity unit, large walk in shower, large deep bath and a walk-in closet. At the front of our suite we had a large terrace with a table, two chairs and sofa. At the rear we had a secluded terrace with plunge pool, outdoor shower and two sun-loungers. However, our honeymoon was a holiday of a life time and we had scrimped and saved and had little money left over to spend whilst on it. This had not caused any problems in Ecuador and The Galapagos Islands where the price of food and drink was reasonable; it did at Esencia. I have to agree with a previous review that describes the mentality of Esencia being that of 'milk the rich'. Unfortunately, we are not rich. Our travel agent had got us a good deal at Escencia and we hadn't considered the price of food and drink. We too noted the $550 (USD) charge for the pre-loaded ipod nano (which is old and very much used) on check in. We declined although they left an ipod in our room for free use whilst staying there. I was paranoid that they would try to charge us for the week's use of something we hadn't asked for, but fortunately they didn't! Meal times. The food is reasonable and the service is generally good. However, the food is over-priced. We completely resented paying what were near to Michelin star prices for food that was certainly not of that quality. On one evening, my husband ordered scallops as a starter. They were cold and so he sent them back. It does not take long to cook scallops from fresh as they are seared. Instead, the kitchen reheated his scallops! We were charged $21 for reheated scallops and that was only the starter! As a previous reviewer states the location is rather remote. We did go to Puerto Aventuras one night for dinner becasue we were so fed-up with Esencia prices (roughly $20 for a starter and $30 for a main course), but found Puerto Aventuras such an awful commercialised place in which the restaurant we ate at was truly terrible, we remained at the hotel subsequently (and gritted our teeth at the hotel prices). Wine. Wine is horrendously expensive at Esencia. When we are on holiday we like to enjoy a bottle of wine with a meal in the evening - especially as this was our honeymoon. The cheapest bottle is $42. The charge for a small glass of wine is $15. This is extortionate. You can buy the cheapest bottle they have on the menu for 158 pesos ($12) in the Wal-Mart in Playa del Carmen. In addition to the extortionate price, the waiting staff aren't particularly good on the etiquette of wine. Every evening we were given the wine list and asked to order from it before being given the food menu. The staff always loked perplexed when we explained that we like to choose what we wanted to eat first and then an appropriate wine to match the food. On one occassion we ordered a bottle of Australian Sauvignon Blanc (price $50). The waiter disappeared to come back to tell us that there was none left, but there was a Chilean Sauvignon Blanc available for the same price, would we accept this as an alternative. We said we would as long as it was no more expensive. He came to the table, showed as the bottle and opened it (screw cap). He then told us it was 'slightly more expensive'. We asked how much it was. We were told $57. I call that a bit more than slightly more expensive. Obviously, now having opened it, I guess they expected us to drink it. We sent it back. My husband was fuming. We then ordered a cheaper bottle of wine. However, I did notice when we sent the more expensive bottle back, the screw cap was replaced and it was put in the fridge. I do wonder if that was served to anybody else as a fresh bottle? I very much hope they either disposed of it, or used it that night to serve wine by the glass. Finally, there is no place to relax and have an after dinner drink. You have to do this at the restaurant. The bar by the pool closes at 9pm. My husband and I wanted to sit in a more relaxed environment than the restaurant and so we decided to order digestivs to the room. We called concierge to be told their is an additional 25% charge on all room service items. We refused to pay this and my husband said he would go to the bar at the restaurant to collect the drinks. We were told there is an additional 15% charge to take drinks away to consume in your room. Another caveat. There is a complimentary minibar in the room which contains lots of water, two cans of Coke, two cans of diet Coke and 2 bottles of beer. This is a nice touch. However, we noticed in the information pack in the room that if you take the drinks from your room to another part of the hotel, you will be (surprise surprise) charged. Lunch - I can't actually comment on this. We didn't eat lunch at all because we couldn't afford it. Breakfast - this was very good and included in our room rate. There is also a lovely selection of breads delivered to the room first thing every morning with fresh coffee. This is complimentary. There was one occassion when a squirrel ran off with our rolls, but concierge were very quick to replace them. Bills - as mentioned by a previous reviewer, bills are not presented at the end of each meal, but an itemised bill is sent to your room every two days. We really didn't like this either. This means that you only find out how much you have spent every two days. With all the added service charges and hidden extras, this made us quite miserable and we constantly worried because we didn't know if we were remainin within our budget. This is not how we should have felt on our honeymoon. Presumably, from the hotel's perspective, we weren't the rich kind of clientele they wish to attract. I despised the fact that I constantly felt that I was too poor to be there. Spa Facilities - The Spa looked beautiful. We booked this hotel partly because of the spa, but we didn't use it because it was cost prohibitive. I believe it was $75 just to use the jacuzzi! In summary beautiful, relaxing and secluded hotel, but the food, wine and service charges were extortionate and because of such I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel that seemed money-grubbing at times”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Escencia for 3 nights. Although it is in a gorgeous setting, what I remember most from my stay is their "soak the rich" mentality". Here are some examples: - During check-in, we were asked if we wanted to purchase the hotel's "pre-loaded" IPOD for $550. With no idea of the songs and completely astounded by the price, I asked if they meant 550 pesos but no, they said it was USD 550. Of course, we said no and are still wondering if they've ever had any takers for such an obscenely expensive hotel souvenir. - The food prices at Escencia were incredibly high because given the remote location, guests have no other dining options. For example, an order of cheese quesadillas for one person were $25 plus tip. Our dinner the first night cost $104 (incl. tax/tip) for which I had a baked fish with salsa, my friend had steak and we shared a small lukewarm apple tart for dessert (and our only beverage was their complimentary water). - You are not given a bill after each meal. Rather a cumulative bill is delivered to your room every other day which shows only the total amount spent at each sitting (ie. there is no listing of itemized food and beverage charges). - At checkout, I wanted to get rid of my pesos so I asked how much I would get if applied my 690 pesos to the final bill which was presented in Dollars. The cashier told me that for 690 pesos, I would be credited $5. When I questioned her more closely and asked her what her exchange rate was, she then offered me $48 for them. Rather cat-and-mouse behavior..... Other than their money obsession, Escencia is a stylish quiet resort located directly on long stretch of sandy white beach. Here are the highlights: - Most of the staff were unobtrusive, helpful and professional. We were generally greeted us with a friendly "hola!" and any time we asked for something, it was done immediately. - Our room was entirely white-washed and had teak furnishings that gave our room a spare but elegant look. The toiletries were from Molton Brown and our room had a large flat screen tv, the famous IPOD for-sale with assorted "world music" and excellent air conditioning. - Escencia had a quiet atmosphere and tended to attract honeymooners and older couples. There was plenty of open space throughout the property and numerous lounge chairs were available at the beach and the 2 pools any time of the day. There was definitely no jockeying for poolchairs. - Complimentary coffee and muffins were left outside our door each morning. As other reviewers have noted, the food attracts the local crows who will start immediately eating it unless you get outside ASAP. We learned this the hard way when our muffins were thoroughly pecked to death one morning so thereafter we vigilantly retrieved our baked goods the minute we heard the dishes rattling. This could all be avoided if the hotel staff just placed a simple domed screen over the food. Other things to note: - There is no exercise facility. - It makes much more sense to rent a car for the day ($80 for 24 hours, arranged through the Concierge) to visit Tulum and Playa del Carmen than to pay for their expensive tours and taxis. - It takes 1 hour to get from the Cancun airport to Escencia by car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpcdo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, you really get a luxury feel when you arrive here for the first time. My room was very spacious and clean. I liked that you get a mini fridge that is refilled daily with a variety of complimentary drinks (water, soda, beers...). The beach is beautiful, and the lounge chairs comfortable. The two pools are nice, one was heated and the other was not so you can choose whatever temperature you prefer. Food is ok, not great, it is actually quite unreliable, some day it could be really good and the next you'd order the same exact dish and it would not taste the same. The guacamole is really really good though! I used the steam room of the spa and I must say it is one of the nicest steam room I've used. This is a very quiet hotel, so if you like doing a lot of activities during your vacation, this is probably not the place for you, but if you want to relax it is perfect. Wifi connection only works in the patio of the main house (near reception), which is too bad because it would be pretty nice to be able to check emails from anywhere in the hotel. In room internet cable did not work.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all!”
Reviews.Author: cenotepapalote
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak entirely on behalf of my girlfriend who fleshed Esensia out of the myriad of options along the Yucatan coastline, but I must admit that it was a slam dunk from my perspective. From the moment that we arrived, with Eduardo behind the wheel and shuttling us from the airport to the unassuming and unpretentious entrance of Esensia, we could immediately sense that this was going to be a place to remember. We were greeted at the gate house (a traditional vernacular Mayan dwelling) with a warm, genuine smiles and an a sensibility of accommodation based around confidence and quiet charm. Snaking our way down a narrow gravel path in a chauffeured golf cart through the jungle, the sound of the passing cars on the main thoroughfare began to fade and the glory of this wonderful place began to take hold. Evidently there are about 26 units sprinkled among the verdant and well kept grounds, yet you would never think that this would be the case. We were given a tour of the main public areas; the amazingly grand and well appointed spa, the two open air bar and restaurant palapas-understated and elegantly simple, the main villa-amazing, two pool areas, and the traditional Mayan tamezcal (sweat lodge). All along the way the staff (grounds keepers, waiters, and concierge) everyone was cordial, pleasant and helpful. Our room, a ground-floor unit of a two story structure, was tastefully simple with a large comfortable bed, ajoining bathroom, a walk-in shower and a private outdoor "chill" area with an amazing "plunge pool" that was automatically heated every evening when we returned from dinner and drinks. Nice touch! Coffee and croissants were served each morning on the quaint front covered porch in quiet anticipation. Our breakfast meals were included with our package and were enjoyed at the beach front palapa; The grapefruit and orange juices were sumptuously fresh, the eggs machacado and the chili relleno stuffed with seasoned eggs and covered with fresh light cheese were off the hook. My mate, who is a pepper-belly asked for a sampling of all their salsas and she was pleasantly rewarded with a delicious array of pico de gallo, pickled onion and a habanero salsa that became the hallmark for these gringos. Hot, hot and hotter! Muy Cabron. The lunch and dinner menus are equally savory; The cold avocado soup, side vegetables, rice, and seafood were lovingly prepared and beautifully presented. Again, my mate, who is a foodie, was especially blown away by the green cerviche; Generous, marinated chuncks of Grouper in a delicate citrus base. Our waiters were always inconspicuously attentive, gracious and helpfully conversant. Margaritas? Refreshingly tart with a hint of sweet-order them with the Don Julio Silver tequilla instead of the Reposada. It is this attention to detail, seemingly insignificant, yet subtle, that we came to appreciate about Esensia. After drinking a few of those Margaritas on the beach, watching the sun set into the western sky, I realized the next morning that I had left my Raybans behind. Frantically I searched everywhere and finding no clues, I approached the concierge with my dashed hopes. He quickly produced them from the closet and said that they were found on the beach. Attention to detail never goes out of style. Style should appear effortless. Detail is attention.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Peaceful Retreat - Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Wonderer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited La Esencia for six nights in February 2009 for our Honeymoon. The trip was flawless beginning to end - starting with the airport pick-up in a new, clean SUV. The first impression is wonderful as you enter a replica of a Mayan hut. The ride on the golf cart through the "jungle" was awesome and really helped us feel like were were "getting away." The room was perfect. The photos on the website are not misrepresenting anything - the room was so peaceful and so inviting - we had a king bed, garden suite with a plunge pool. We used the plunge pool everyday - so that was a good pick. The food is fabulous, it really is. From the coffee and pastries in the room to the full breakfast to the beach lunches to the great dinners - we feasted the whole time! The staff was great and helped arrange excursions for us (Tulum, Playa, etc.) but we really just preferred to stay on the property! The beach and pool were great. The spa was amazing. I had one treatment and we went and used the hot tubs as well. The only thing I would suggest for improvement is a small cocktail lounge or something. After dinner - we sometimes found ourselves looking for somewhere to go or to socialize with other guests we met - and there wasn't a formal place to go - so we'd end up sitting in the back area - which was still great. This was honestly one (if not the) best places I've ever stayed. This is on our "will return" list.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: stvcmpnl4
Reviews.Content: This estate which was preowned by an Italian Dutchess his certainly fit for a King or Queen. We returned last week from our second trip to Esencia Estate. Last year, we stayed in a standard room and this visit in January, we stayed in the suite villa on second floor with private plunge pool. I can't say enough about this place nor the friendly and accomodating staff. As soon as you arrive into the Airport of Cancun, you are greeted with your private transfer to the hotel, and upon arrival you are greeted as if you are guests of the Italian Dutchess herself. No stone is left unturned at this paradisical place. And the spa is a complete sactuary and blissful piece of heaven on this estate. All there at your fingertips, there is no need to leave this place. We went into town one night; however, we couldn't wait to get back to our 50 acres of private refuge.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Paradise even better this time around”
Reviews.Author: EvanR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a great week at the Dutchesses former home on the beach. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left pure paradise. This was our second visit this year to Essencia and the staff was amazing. Due not hesitate to ask for anything as they are more than happy to assist. Chef Miguel and Bernardo were amazing any request we had they one upped us. No need to leave the resort. From Miquel on the beach to Juan and Omar in the restaurants the week was amazing. In addition if you were ever wondering where a certain Mexican beer company filmed their beach commercials here it is. They were using the beach for their all of 2010 commercials.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: FedericaM3
Reviews.Content: Incredible place, very little hotel, great service, fantastic Spa

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: lilgil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during a promotion for credit toward food, drink, spa, etc. Everything about the hotel and the promotion exceded our expectaions. The staff is exceptional, the food is rather good, but the beach is simply one of the best I have ever seen. There are lagoons nearby that someone will take you to, and even pack a lunch. The best part are the beach huts which they'll place anywhere you like, and are excellent for sun protection. We hope to return soon, with our son, as it appears the hotel is also quite kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Esencia Estate - What a Paradise . . .”
Reviews.Author: Cun_8
Reviews.Content: You completely forget about your daily routine when you stay at Esencia Estate. This is a place to relax and enjoy the sounds of the ocean, the breeze and the birds, it's very peaceful, quiet, relaxing and beautiful. The aromatic coffee, the morning sweet rolls and the gourmet cuisine are delicious. There are Thai Chi and Yoga classes or if you prefer, there is also Wii Fit in your room and to end your day visit the fabulous SPA, is quite an experience. The entire staff is very professional and friendly. It's our third visit and we can't wait to go back again ! Val & Martha Chepeleff

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KJWED
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem! Special, lovely and beautiful. The spa is incredible and quite the unique experience (my partner and i did the lovers ritual), and the lobby speaks true to the nature of the entire resort - quiet, understated luxury. The food is incredible, the patrons suited my style, and i would honestly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet getaway. From my experience of some of the other beaches on the Riviera Maya, this one (i think it's called Xpu-ha) is stunning. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: 65mstang
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Esencia, and we miss it so much. I took my wife to Esencia for our honeymoon, and it was the perfect choice. This was by far the best service we had ever experienced at a hotel. Catalina and Nicholas at the concierge desk were very helpful setting up excursions for us, and giving us restaurant recommendations in Playa. Omar and all of the waitstaff were great. They anticipated our needs and really took excellent care of us. The food was great. We ate breakfast everyday poolside. I had the french toast twice during the stay because it was the best I have ever had. We were so full from breakfast that for lunch we often had something light like guacamole and chips. I also had several of their ceviches, and they were all excellent. Their seafood was always fresh and very good. For dinner, the hotel restaurant is under a large palapa roof and is open-air. They light it up with lots of candles, and it is very romantic. There were few people at the hotel during our stay, and we were often the only people in the restaurant at night. One night we went into Playa for shopping. Nicholas recommended El Fogon as a restaurant with local flavor. Most of the other customers were locals, and we had fajitas which were excellent. The beach at Esencia is very nice. They take great pains in keeping it clean from seaweed and other debris. The water is clear and good for swimming. There are a few rocky areas which provide opportunity for snorkeling 10 meters or so out. We went on several long walks down the beach, and as you move away from the Esenica you do see some trash on the beach, but not much. Of course, this is out of their control. We stayed in a Garden Suite room with a plunge pool. The upgrade to a room with a plunge pool was free since the hotel was not full during our stay. The rooms have ipod docking stations which we enjoyed playing our music. The shower room is very nice and big with two large shower heads. The room had a new Philips flat screen tv and sony dvd player. We watched a couple of movies during the stay from Esencia's DVD collection. In general the furnishings in the room are very minimalist, but elegant. They always kept the fridge stocked with water, soft drinks, and a couple of beers. We also received fresh fruit in the room every day. The Esencia is not a low cost option. While our stay was not inexpensive, I feel we received a lot of value. As I said earlier, the staff was amazing. I don't really know how to explain the level of service. For the two of us food, drink, and service charges for the week set us back about $1000.

Reviews.Title: “SEVEN STAR HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: benax
Reviews.Content: We have been fortunate to have stayed at many small luxury hotels around the World, and without doubt, Esencia is by far, the best, all around hotel, in the most amazing location, we have ever been to. We stayed with our kids (3 & 9) and the level of service and premises for up-scale family travel is compared to none. The food was amazing, the staff was outstanding, the estate is remarkable, the beach & sea incomparable. Esencia is no questions asked the best hotel in the World for leisure, fine dining and relax. Congratulations to the first 7 star hotel in the World!

Reviews.Title: “Wow... best hotel i've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: SuperEagle78
Reviews.Content: I booked an "Essence of Love" package in Esencia (5 night ocean view suite) as part of my honeymoon. The booking went very smoothly and Maria et others were very responsive to my requests. A couple of weeks before my departure I got an email from Esencia to break the good news that there was a cancellation in one of their exclusive villas and that I was offered a free upgrade for the first two nights! Anyway, we got there on d day, transfer and check in were really smooth then we were taken on a cart through the jungle for a tour of the hotel. We were really impressed. This is basically an untouched jungle with wonderful villas and suites scattered here and there. Then we werre shown to our villa. I cannot even start to describe how wonderful it was. I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. A couple of days later we were transferred to our suite (i.e while we were on the beach sipping a cocktail, the staff packed our stuff and moved it to the suite without bothering us) and it was as nice, with the ocean view on one side and the jungle view on the other side. I may have gone on for ages about how nice the setting is, and the colour of the water...etc but I think what sets this hotel apart is really the SERVICE. I know that many hotels have good intentions of providing a good service but the execution in this hotel is flawless. All the staff from the maids to the waiters to the concierges are really friendly. No over the top fake friendliness or commercial smiles. They listen to you and are genuinely nice and talkative. I will just give a few examples to show how efficient is the service. - We rented a car. The hotel took care of all the arrangements and picked us up from the beach when the Europcar guys came. When I need the car i Just need to call the concierge and a golf cart waits immediately for me to take me to the reception where I find my car waiting for me and the keys handed to me. When I come back to the residence, the doorman opens the doos (after quickly checking the serial number), and calls the reception on talkie walkie. By the time I reach the reception ( a few seconds), a concierge is already waiting for me outside to take the keys and ark the car and a golf cart is waiting to take me to my suite. - The waiters on the beach anticipate your needs. It's incredible. Once we had a picnic arranged by the hotel on the beach and included a bottle of white wine. After a couple of glasses from the bottle, the waiter came and suggested I might need some ice to col the bottle, which I ust did. - In this hotel you basically do not worry about anything and nobody bothers you about any admin stuff and signing stuff. You just ask for something and it's done immediately and it's flawless. All of this of course comes at a price. I went there becuase it's my honeymoon but can't afford this on a regular basis. However if you can, this hotel is really worth the price tag. This review is my thank you note for the hotel, all the staff and the wonderful time we spent there with my wife. Only advice: the hotel is wonderful but the region is worth exploring so rent a car and definitely check out xel-ha park, Tulum, the Cenotes...etc

Reviews.Title: “Escencia: Where Time is Lost”
Reviews.Author: hesty
Reviews.Content: we have never been anywhere like this & we never wanted to leave!! gorgeous rooms nestled within the tropical trees...complete privacy that we felt at times we were all alone. white sand & crystal clear water...five star dining...the 'silent service' where whatever you wanted was just a mere request away...& not to mention the spa....unlike anything we have ever been to before...capturing the true myan heritage while making you feel so totally relaxed...we are making this a yearly trip for sure!! we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations too high ???”
Reviews.Author: carpis
Reviews.Content: After massive research and stress of selecting a 5 star hotel in the Maya Riviera for my 5 star world traveler husband’s 60th birthday, I choose Esencia for our 9 day stay. I could not find a bad review of this hotel in the past 2 years, so my expectations going in were extremely high. I booked through www.whatahotel.com and they did a fabulous job of getting me their signature travel benefits. Pick up at the airport was efficient but we were given no help lugging our luggage to the car. After just over an hour’s drive we pulled into a very unassuming entrance and welcomed in the Mayan hut (reception) we thought this was very charming. We were then driven down a small path through the jungle towards the hotel. We were then graciously walked around the property, finally ending up at our room where we found the bags. I was a little disappointed as I had asked for a room nearest the sea, in fact we were given a room farthest away from the sea. At that point we were just pleased to get into a room and changed. This was the high point of the trip; my husband was really pleased with the choice of hotel as it was a surprise treat and looked wonderful before further review. We found all the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Our dining experiences were baffling, we never knew what type of service to expect;(sometimes quickly, sometimes slow and sometimes they remembered us sometimes not). After 5 days of this, the final straw was breakfast at 7am. We were the first and only people in the restaurant… it took 25 minutes to get a simple omelet and when it finally arrived it was cold. My husband finally blew a gasket, he complained, sent it back, and received a new breakfast within 5 minutes. He also complained to the management about the service and from then on we did receive better service in the restaurants. At first glance, the rooms seem very nice and look much nicer on the website. All rooms had Molten Brown bath products, white cotton robes and haviannas flip flops to use the duration of your stay. Also, the room had a small refrigerator that was stocked daily with complimentary drinks. After closer inspection we noticed the chipping white paint, floors that are never clean unfinished exposed electrical boxes, taped bathroom sink faucets and a musty smell in the room. The first room we were in an animal had pooped outside the front door over night. This mess was never cleaned up; we moved rooms that day to a room nearer the beach. The second room was very noisy due to the wind, rattling the doors, windows and screens. When the wind did die down and we had no a/c on during the night we were woken by road noise from the nearby highway. I had read the pool and beach service was wonderful, we did not experience this at all. In fact, if I wanted water or a drink I needed to go to the restaurant and get one. No one ever came by the pool or beach to ask if we needed anything. The highlight of the day was at 4pm, tea and biscuits were served, on the verandah of the main house, this was wonderful. Another very upsetting thing for me was they completely ignored my husband’s 60th birthday, no card.. no flowers… no acknowledgement… of the special day, which was the point of this trip. The spa was wonderful and the treatments were fabulous, it was a haven not to be missed. It would have been nice if there was a gym. Unfortunately, the weather was not great. We had 5 continuous days of very heavy winds. After 7 days we had had enough, I had a terrible stomach bug, (Montezuma’s) and could not eat anything without running to the toilet; my husband had a terrible cold and cough so we decided to leave. At check out, to add insult to injury, the hotel decided to charge us for the 2 days we were not staying. After much shouting and aggravation they did remove the 2 days from the final bill. Not a nice ending to a hotel stay. Overall, it did not feel like a 5 star hotel and definitely not worth the price of the rooms. It didn’t feel like there was anyone in charge of the hotel. It felt like a lack of fine tuning and training for the staff. The rooms need to be finished properly, not patched. The setting is wonderful and the frame work is there for a fabulous hotel but not just yet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect long valentines weekend”
Reviews.Author: kohlbis
Reviews.Content: Esencia was beautiful and the staff were exactly what we had hoped they would be. We stayed on the second floor of the main house in an ocean view suite - the room was great and the location ideal. We enjoyed a "couples ritual" (massage) at the Aroma Spa, it was perfect and romantic. The beach was beautiful. We enjoyed dinner at the restaraunt as well as beachside one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Gracias Esencia”
Reviews.Author: shoohalhaki
Reviews.Content: Heaven ..beautiful rooms ...amazing beach ..nice staff Amazing SPA The food could use some upgrade Do the Yoga in the morning. Go to Tulum Do not bother with Playa del carmen

Reviews.Title: “Esencia Dream”
Reviews.Author: SSemone
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and the staff was so nice. The hotel, which only has 29 rooms, is the perfect setting for a relaxed getaway. I never had a problem getting a beach hut to lay under as the beach was never crowded. The food was wonderful. I think I tried everything on the breakfast menu. My Favorites for breakfast were the chilaquiles, Rancher eggs, Sardou eggs and the French toast. The spa was nice and sweet with all organic ingredients. I recommend the Yoga as someone stated before. The rooms were very minimalist. They were not my favorite, but I didn't mind them too much either. The hotel as a whole is worth going besides the room. The beds were comfortable and the rain showers were great. This is a place to come and rejuvenate and worry about nothing. If you want to try something fun and different they have kite surfing classes down the beach at a place called FreeStylePlaya. I only ate one meal out of the hotel at a place down the beach. The food was great-- I had Shrimps Diablo. Oh-- and another thing not to be missed is cooking class. You can take the class right there with the hotel chef. They have plenty of free water and they fill your mini bar with a few beers and drinks every day. This is really a nice touch. All in all this was a great place and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritjw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Esencia was fabulous! The staff was wonderful. Brought us complimentary wine upon arrival without us even asking! We loved: the beach, our heated plunge pool, our room, the food(especially breakfast & lunch), the staff, the privacy We didn't love: the birds sometime screaming outside our room in the morning. Only left the hotel once for dinner in Playa del Carmen, which was excellent. This was such a relaxing vacation! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: remember
Reviews.Content: It seemed fortuitous that the room we were given was called Paradise because that's exactly what it is! We simply loved it. And we're not merely talking about the beautifully designed room but the entire experience of staying at Esencia. The room itself was understated and elegant, which is much better than the riot of colours and decorations that seem to perpetuate other hotels. Our pictures just don't do justice to the real thing. It was unpretentious and simply luxurious reinforcing the serenity that surrounds the estate itself. The the staff are extremely friendly, unobtrusive but attentive, emphasizing their focus on making their guests feel at home. We felt like pampered guests, and there was nothing that was too much trouble or inconvenient. We originally planned to make short trips to Playa but we felt so rested and pampered at Esencia that we didn't even bother leaving the hotel! I have stayed at other Small Luxury Hotels and 5 star resorts but it is the little things that Esencia offers that really sets it apart--from tranquility of the estate and the room to the abundance of towels in the bathroom, free flow of drinks in the mini bar,, Haviana slippers provided for your stay and the quiet, efficient attention you receive from the staff there. Staying at Esencia is really an experience. It is really a piece of paradise. We did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsg8808
Reviews.Content: Hotel Esencia is heaven on earth! My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon there and have vowed to return. Even the gorgeous pictures on their website do not do it justice. When you arrive to the hotel, you are whisked away on a golf cart through the jungle to get to the property. This is the only way in and out of the property, so if you plan on leaving a lot, it can be a hassle. However, we only left twice- once to go to Cozumel and once to visit Tulum. I highly recommend both trips, but can see why people never leave Esencia! The Rooms Our room was very nice. We stayed in the Menta room, which was an upstairs Garden Suite with an amazing plugepool that looked across the jungle (although you can see some of the monstrous other hotels in the distance). The maid comes once a day to change the sheets and towels and then again for turn down, which I loved! Some of the local creatures (bugs and salamanders) did sneak inside, and normally I am horrified by bugs, but I didn't let it bother me. Somehow it was fitting with the environment. We brought our ipod to hook up to the surround sound system and loved being able to listen to our own music. Also, the beds are heavenly! The Food Food is big at Esencia- since it is pretty much the only place you will eat unless you wan to pay $20 each way for a taxi into Playa del Carmen, which is the closest town. It is on the pricier side, but the quality is excellent. I always get sick in Mexico, usually from the food, and am happy to say that I did not get sick this trip. They start the morning off with complimentary tea or coffee (you tell them what you prefer when you arrive) and pastries. We waged war with the birds to get our pastries, but it was well worth the 7:30 am wake-up. Breakfast was included with our stay, which I also recommend, because it allowed us to pig out guilt free for one meal a day. They also serve complimetary tea and coffee in the main house at 5:00 which we participiated in every day. It allowed us to unwind after a tiresome day at the beach and check our email (its the only internet available on the property). The Beach The beach was incredible during our stay. Some previous posts mention a dirty beach, but I disagree. There are some rocky parts of the beach, but there are also some rock free parts as well. Make sure you ask to borrow some goggles so you can explore the wildlife living in the rocks! The best huts fill up quickly (I preferred the huts that did not have sides because they felt more roomy), so get there early to stake your claim. The Spa We used the steam room and cold jacuzzi every day t the spa (it's free) and loved relaxing in their little meditation area. On our second to last night we got the Him and Hers rituals in the same room and it was heavenly! The ritual was incredible and the prices are pretty reasonable. I recommend doing the morning yoga at least once during your stay. It was the most intense yoga ever because of the weather (hot and humid, even at 9:00 am), but definitely an experience. The Service One of our favorite parts of our stay was the excellent service at Esencia. Everyone knew our names by the second day and were super friendly. By the end of the week, we felt like part of the Esencia family.

Reviews.Title: “Invisible Hands”
Reviews.Author: High-LowAdventures
Reviews.Content: Exclusive (not snobby just uncrowded with tons of privacy) estate on the Riveira Maya was a treat to experience. The room's decor is minimal yet warm and luxurious and adheres to their philosophy of stripping down all the ornaments and details and leaving only what's essential to complete relaxation. The grounds are really nice, distances between the rooms and the rest of the buildings on the property are short. Their spa is inspired by the local traditional Mayan culture and comes off authentic- not wannabe at all. They have their own herb garden which they use in their treatments. Fans of organic, all-natural products will be satisfied with the overall philosophy and practices of the spa. The restaurant was good, I give it a B+. The beach is quite nice in the morning. Later in the afternoon the tide brings in natural seaweed. It's not displeasing just perhaps not what you were expecting. The sand is amazing and the color of the ocean is what you came here for. There are 2 pools and various chill out spots. What makes this place stand out is the service. Invisible hands seem to anticipate your every need at precisely the right times. Beach hut service is AMAZING. You are waited on without feeling overwhelmed by being constantly 'bothered'. The staff to guest ratio makes you feel very well pampered in a genuine and personal way. This type of place attracts people who want to lay low and enjoy the surroundings and each other. People respected each other's privacy yet when we did interact with others they were really polite and considerate. The value of the room/resort is very good. A The value of spa is very good. A The value of the restaurant is good. B+ Here I felt that although you'd expect to be overcharged for resort fine dining, the food was high-end for local standards but for a San Franciscan expecting world-class cuisine it was lacking. Wine selection was pretty weak as well. Breakfast picked up the slack and was amazing. try local dishes as they've obviously got these mastered. The place is totally worth it's newer than the Maroma property and a great place for a rest if you are in the area and sick of the Eco-pseudo-chic cabanas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel we have ever had the pleasure of staying in!! Airport collection was on-time and efficiet. The welcome is warm and relaxed, particularly love the ride in the Golf-cart to the resort - really fancy a go at driving that thing! The room was lovely - decked out with roses for our anniversary - with complimentary bottle of wine - nice touch! Had garden suite with plunge pool - agree with previous review - you would never know there was anyone else there - only ocasionally disturbed by Iguanas, Geccos, Basilisks and butterflys. The coffee and breads first thing is a nice touch - great before the complimentary Tai Chi and Yoga, prior to an excellent breakfast - the staff are very accomodating to slightlyeccentric English requests - even off menu. Ceviches are amazing - just watch the "spicy sauce" they offer - it is really hot. The pools and beach are impeccably managed - yes there is some debris- but it is a beach and seaweed and shells do get washed up - some plastic cups on the beach further up - but it is a federal beach - not a private beach and it's several kilometres long - they can't clear it all - get angry with the people that drop stuff - not the hotel for not clearing every single last bit up! Dolly got to the Esencia before we did - and damaged one of the pools - maintenance worked all the hours to get it fixed - just as we were leaving - really sorry to have missed the opportunity to try it out. The Margaritas - especially the Golden Margaritas are excellent , water is purified and safe as ice. Copious gratis bottles of water are provided everywhere,the wine list varied and reasonable including both new and old world, the evening meals were excellent - portion sizes can be large. Particularly liked the chef special menus - Regional multi course affairs - with charming explanations from the waiting staff. Opportunity to try stuff I would never have had the nerve or inclination to try without this "tasting menu" type thing - really good. Snorkelling trip with Lucas - the Dive Master, was amazing. Boat trip off main beach (where there is some reef) to the main reef - saw stingray, sea turtles (can't be that dirty!) and so many tropical fish I lost count - the personal snorkels in the rooms are a nice touch - and you can borrow masks and visors from the beach attendants. Without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in - not the most spectacular room or view - but the most attentive, polite, friendly staff - nothing is too much trouble. The grounds are impeccably maintained and the atmosphere relaxed. The spa is well run and the treatments exceeded expectations. The only downside - the damn mosquitoes - they clear them out every 3 days - but they are a menace - use the complimentary "Bye-Bye" repellant - it works, they have it everywhere. The tax and service issue mentioned elsewhere was made quite clear to me when I booked directly with the hotel - it means you don't need to keep money on you for tipping - really liked that. Going back next year - can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hideaway”
Reviews.Author: WDC23
Reviews.Content: Far from the crowds, Esencia was a little piece of paradise on the Rivieran Maya. The hotel is intimate and beautiful, nestled in a lush estate. The staff are exceptionally attentive and professional. I highly recommend this place to those looking for serenity and peace- you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent and magical!”
Reviews.Author: Maricusa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay at the Esencia hotel. This was our second visit to this hotel. We travel all around the world when on vacation and this is the only place we have gone back to visit. Perfect setting for relaxation and to recharge your soul with positive energy. This hotel is located in one of the most magical areas of the Riviera Maya where you may perceive the great energy that flows in the area. The rooms are very peaceful and comfortable. In the bathrooms the showers are wonderful with wood floor and two different showerheads, one of them a rain shower. The hotel provides ipods in the rooms with very beautiful music. We never left the hotel during our stay. I love yoga and they a great yoga teacher named Hania who teaches from Monday - Friday at 9am. Saturdays and Sundays they provide Tai-Chi classes with a very good teacher. To complete your relaxation you may go to one of the best spas I have visited around the world. This spa is like a magical place where different massages and treatments are provided. Try a reiki with Gerardo or a facial with Azucena and you will notice that they are masters in their field. The food is excellent and you may ask the chef to prepare something special during your stay. All waiters go an extra mile to help you and will personalize your visit by calling you by your name the next day. Well, I highly recommend this place if you want to feel special and enrich your soul. We just came back and we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: LondonDamos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May and had a very nice time. Its a very quiet hotel with only a few rooms - so you have plenty of peace. Perfect for honey mooners and those looking for total relaxation - but don't expect too much of a buzz in the evenings. You can head into Playa del Carmen for that though. Staff are very friendly and the food is good. There is a very nice beach with little cabanas for lounging in, although we spent most of our time by the 2 pools. Our room was large and clean, with plunge pool for cooling off... although by late afternoon it got so warmed by the sun that it was more like a hot bath!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld2003
Reviews.Content: Esencia is truly a gem. From the moment you arrive you are treated with exceptional service. You are taken on a private tour of the grounds via a golf cart. The grounds are perfectly manicured with palm trees, banana trees, cactus and numerous tropical trees which makes you feel like you are in the jungle. The beach is private and the staff at the beach attends to all of you needs. We were provided cold towels to cool off while we were sunbathing. The restaurant is fabulous with excellent cuisine and top notch wines. We went to the spa for a massage and all their ingredients are organic. The spa is certainly worth indulging in during your stay. We stayed in a garden room with a plunge pool and private deck and it was clean, neat and has a simple modern look with all the luxuries-such as a flat screen tv and molton brown toiletries. The staff brings fresh fruit to the room- which was a nice touch. I would recommend this boutique hotel to those looking for peace and quiet. This is not a place to come and party. I would recommend for honeymooners, couples and families that have well mannered children.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Vacation”
Reviews.Author: eljoy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a wonderful week at Esencia. It was truly a beautiful property. It is so hidden that you are not really sure what you will find. The grounds and buildings are arranged privately. As for the beach, it was clean and the only negative was that there were a few windy days and the water was not as calm as it usually is. One day when it was windy we stayed by the pool. Of course, there is no control over the weather. The beach had beautiful sand and we were able to take long walks every day. No one bothered you on the beach. The care and attention of the staff was great. Everyone was extremely polite. The sauna was great. We had relaxing massages and able to use the jacuzzi and steam rooms when we wished. It was a truly great vacation. If you are looking for actiivy this is not the place for you. We did go to Playa del Carmen one nite, but could not wait to get back to the hotel. We also went to Tulum one morning and took a tour there which we enjoyed, but again was so happy to be back at Esencia. it is truly a place to unwind and relax! Take some good books, sun lotion & enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J&KBoulder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 week at Esencia in February. We had fabulous weather! The hotel is small and beautiful. It is very simply decorated and the grounds perfectly manicured. The bed was extrememly comfortable. We used to say it was like sleeping in a big marshmallow as the bedding was all done in white with great pillows and the softest comforter cover. We had a garden suite on the ground level. I requested an upper level suite but I was happy with the lower after seeing the unit above us. We had a great outside area that the upstairs units do not have. We had a "solarium" - a nice size deck made all private with its surrounding garden with a nice size plunge pool, 2 great chaise lounges and an additional outside shower.We were lucky that we were in one of the garden suites closest to the main house. However if I were to book again I would definately spend the extra money and get one of the few ocean view rooms as they would have more air flow through the suite. The garden suites are very tucked in and I missed the ocean breeze and sound of the waves. We both loved the food at Esencia! The breakfasts could be as light - simple juices and fruit plates - or substantial as you preferred. The scrambled egg stuffed poblanos and the Mexican Eggs were deliciou. The ceviche menu at lunch, though expensive - $25 - 30 each - were so refined, fresh, and addiciting. We originally thought we would go for a few dinners away from the resort but fell in love with the food and the ambiance of the El Fuego. We actually ordered appetizers and soups for dinner several nights. The lobster taquitos, stuffed jalapenos, and corn soup were favorites. One evening there was a Mexican Buffet with complimentary Mexican drinks and music. We don't really like buffets but this one was done so well and the waiters asked what you would like and then got your food. I must mention that all the help - the beach attendants, waiters, bartenders, concierge - were extremely and genuinely helpful and attentive. I loved that there were 2 pools - one for adults only and one for children. Both pools were just off the beach so gorgeous views and breezes. There was always ample space at both pools and often we were the only ones taking a dip. We did spend most of our time on the beach on the wonderfully comfortable chaise lounges. Again, ample room for all. We would walk the long beach of Xpuha. Swimming was better south of the hotel near a big resort (don't know its name). Now to the Big Negative: The beach/ocean when looking at it from the distance was beautiful. Turquoise water and rolling waves. However when you walked on the beach some distance or swam it was rather filthy as another poster mentioned. There was all sorts of crap in the water and washed up on the beach. One morning the beach attendant who was raking our beach pulled up a siringe! He shook his head in disgust! I really couldn't enjoy a swim in this water as everytime I tried to take a swim a piece of plastic would wrap around my leg or brush against my body. YUCK! We have not been to this area of Mexico for 12 - 14 years. My husband and I were shocked at the growth. We had been to this beach when nothing but a few private homes were there. It is a shame that the growth of the Mayan Riviera has not developed with a consciousness for the pristine beauty this land once possessed. Environmental issues are not at all important to this land and that is a major turn off and reason for us probably not returning dispite the beauty of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too much garbage on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Blair2276
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey -- watch out for the 15% government tax and 10% surcharge that will be factored onto your hotel bill once you arrive. Our $648/ night room ended up costing us $770/night. The hotel is beautiful and we thought the food was wonderful but the beach was absolutely filthy! The hotel boasts that is located on a two mile stretch of "pristine" beach; unfortunately, this is not the case. Esencia keeps the area directly in front of the hotel's pool clean (about 200 feet) but in order to avoid the rocks, you must go to the side of this area to swim. That's where the garbage and filth lies. We spent one afternoon counting the old shoes and water bottles that littered the beach! We brought this to the manager's attention and asked if there was anything that could be done, and he simply shrugged his shoulders. We have stayed at other small hotels (Bucuti in Aruba) and they go so far as to organize volunteer beach clean up mornings and give a bottle of champagne to the participants as incentive. I'm not what you would call an environmentalist, but I was bothered by the garbage and was in fear of stepping on something sharp while in the water. The hotel sells itself on the beach's "pristine" description and I feel Escencia and its neighboring hotels have a responsibility to keep the beach clean. We all do! What a shame... it could be beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall but a little impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Asby08
Reviews.Content: Went to esencia after having spent a few days at Tides Riviera Maya (formerly Ikal del mar). Spent 4 nights in a great seaview suites. Room and amenities were perfect (lacks european style bathrobe though) , setting of the villa and beach perfect too. clearly one of the best option of the riviera maya by far (with tides and Maroma). A few lowdown: food is so-so (but I haven't had a great meal anywhere else anyway), some employees should get another job since tnterpersonal skills are cleary not their strong suit. Last but not least, quite expensive compared to asia's best options (900 $ a night as far as I was concerned). See other review for Tides

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Tisy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a ten night stay and have nothing bad and everything good to say. A unique setting, fabulous rooms (if you like the modern minimal feel), truly attentive service not the cheesy welcome form the major chain hotels, beautiful pools, excellent food from breakfast lunch to dinner, superb margharitas, very nice quiet beach with great little beach huts for shade, endless soft white towels on all beds with plenty to spare, iced towels at the height of the day, snorkeling kits for exploring the water (plenty of fish for us amateurs), absolutely superb Mayan spa and we do not really go to spas........what more do you want?? To give you an idea of the area, Esencia is an hour out of Cancun. There is basically one straight road running along the coastline which is a coastline of hotels. Its not like Cancun where the hotels are on top of each other. The are all by the look of them huge complexes in their own secluded settings including some golf resorts. if you like the larger hotels then there looks to be some fantastic choices however if you like the smaller place with incredible attention to detail where nothing seems to be too much, then Esencia is for you. There are only 29 rooms which are either split level houses or houses in there own grounds with secluded gardens, swimming pools and plunge pools all very private and secluded. You really have to look hard to see the other houses as they are so private. our plunge pool was screened with jungle plants and you really wouldnt know anybody was around you. There is no glitzy entrance at Esencia, its not their style and they are promoting subtlety and seclusion. You are greeted at the Mayan hut, checked in and taken to your accomodation in a golf buggy through the jungle. It is wonderful and beautifully cared for. The path is paved but is in keeping with the jungle surroundings. We were then taken by the manager, Angel, on a low key tour to familiarise us with the resort. The houses are shrouded in exotic trees and plants and plenty of wildlife - nothing that should worry you though! Do expect to see Iguanas, lizards, ghekos, crickets, herons, eagles, amazing other birds, the occasional snake, mozzies but they provide you with eco friendly spray so you dont need to take your own and......well we werent really sure what it was but a cross between a racoon and a monkey that kept stealing our pre breakfast pastries in the morning!
