It got so excited one morning it pushed thy clay pot off the table at 6am waking up the neighbours with a terrible smash and ran off with my croissant! we waited for him the next morning and caught him on video, excellent memories! Esencia is off the beaten track but you wont really want to go anywhere else. we will return and we would rent a car next time for part of the holiday. Taxis are cheap however its just personal choice. If there was one thing which became a little testing.......it was the guests from the hotel at the other end of the beach who eyed Esencia admiringly, expressing disappointment at their choice and asking at least twice a day how we came to find Esencia. it wasnt a problem at all actually. maybe we wouldnt have gone there had we not read the reviews on tripadvisor so thanks everybody for that. its a real treat, not for all but we took our nine year old boy and he was sooo happy. worth it just for that. not for teenagers though. hope of help.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: live4sf
Reviews.Content: The service is impeccable. The staff are lovely. The spa is fabulous and tranquil. The food is amazing (better than anything else you will find in surrounding areas). The beach is stunning as is the turquoise water. I cannot say enough about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Essence of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: allenonmtn
Reviews.Content: My family was able to stay at Esencia from December 26th-January 2 2008. Let me start off my saying that we have done a lot of traveling and it is very hard to find a hotel that addresses all of our families wants and needs. We we went into this vacation expecting good times and fun, and we left with memories that we will remember forever. Our dream started when we entered the jungle like atmosphere of the hotel and were dropped off at the reservation desk, which is a small, nicely appointed where we then received our room key. Our baggage had already left our hands and was being taken to our room, we opted for a two bedroom cottage named Amanacer (dawn). From the hut we were driven via golf-cart down a short trail to a waiting member of the concierge staff ready to take us on a tour of the complex. We visited the spa where they make most everything they use from their organic herb garden, and he also showed us the concierge's office where they have an array of DVD's, board games and also extra sunscreen. Our house had a living room and media room on the bottom floor and two bedrooms with a large terrace overlooking the pool on the top floor. It was decorated very minimally, but wasn't too cold either. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathrooms were clean. The only problem we had with our bathroom was that in the master bathroom the hot water took a while to turn on, but the duel shower heads were very nice when it did. There was a kitchen in our room, but it was closed and could only be used if a private chef came to make our meals in our house for us. Some activities that I would recommend are that at least one night while you are there take a trip into Playa Del Carmen to have dinner. Their fifth avenue has many nice stores and restaurants, and they seem to have a very active night life, if that is what you are interested in. Our family also went on a snorkeling trip in the ocean that you can arrange with the concierge. A boat picked us up right on Esencia's beach and took us out about 500 meters to a reef. We snorkeled out there for about an hour and saw many fish and even a sting ray. The great thing about snorkeling with a private instructor and not a big group is that you have one on one attention if you are in a group of people who are on many different levels, and you can choose how much time you spend out there. We went out with a young man named Lucas who was very polite and kept us all safe and entertained. One final activity that I would recommend is driving to Tulum for a few hours and walk around the ruins that overlook the water, it is a great place to bring your camera. The food was definitely one of the highlights of our trip, and definitely come with an empty stomach, because you will want to try a bit of everybody's. For breakfast we enjoyed the chilequiles and the french toast, and for lunch the ceviche is a must. Dinner was always lovely, and I would recommend the red snapper and the crab salad. We were there for new years eve, and the hotel served us a complementary five course meal by the pool which was exquisite. From the moment you enter Esencia you can tell that service is one of their number one priorities. It seamed like everybody there wanted to make our stay memorable and they received great joy from doing so. All of the waiters are friendly and the people at the concierge desk are helpful. Antonio and Elias were our family's favorite waiters! It may sound like I am exaggerating and gushing, but it is the least that I can say about this hotel. It is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Esencia Is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: moabhiker
Reviews.Content: It has been awhile since my husband and I stayed at Esencia but we both loved it! Our room was super comfortable...with a very private plunge pool. The staff was great. The breakfasts and lunches were to die for and my husband is an award winning chef so we know great food. And, of course, there is the location. I don't normally return to places; I always like to explore and discover something new...but I will definitely return to Esencia!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach and Service!”
Reviews.Author: mdkohn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hotel Esencia for 7 days for a must-needed relaxing vacation. We have stayed at many wonderful hotels around the world, and this was truly our favorite ever based on service, atmosphere, and, of course, the wonderful beach! We did much research on this site, so we wanted to reciprocate. The dates we were there were Oct 25 - 31, 2007. The Beach First, this is one of the most beautiful beaches we've ever been to. The sand is soft, clean, and cool to the touch, even in the heat. The water is crystal-clear and blue. Fairly shallow for a long while. It was calm most days and even when rougher in other spots along the beach, was more calm along this area due to the peninsula to the left of this particular beach. We did not snorkel much, but there are good spots for it. There is sea grass, but it is in limited areas and you can go swim/float quite a distance without seeing it. No need for shoes in the water. The Hotel It is amazingly beautiful. It is very white, as some have commented. We loved the cleanliness and minimalism of it. I've posted some pictures to show. We were in a garden room, called Romero. It was very private. We never heard anyone the whole time. There was a great area to lay on a daybed and read outside or take in room service. This was contreversial on the postings, but we liked it - 15% is added to everything to cover all gratuities and you never receive or have to wait for a bill at dinner, they put it under your door every couple of days. I think this is partically why the service was always so great. I'll describe a typical day at Esencia to illustrate how wonderful the service is. Between 7 and 8 am, coffee, fresh-squeezed juice, and sweet rolls are delivered to your room. They do not disturb you and leave it outside. As others have said, if you wait, a bird will get to it. However, they do cover the juice, rolls, etc., so this only happened to us one day. Then, you can go have breakfast at the pool area, included in the rate. Breakfast is truly wonderful and very large there. You always get rolls (again, if you want), fruit plate, and mango jelly. You also choose from the menu. Mexican eggs, Frittatas, French toast, etc. Very, very good. Then, when you go back to your room, they have typically cleaned it or in the process of wrapping up cleaning it. We usually headed to the beach at that point. The beach service is the best I've ever had anywhere. They give you snorkeling equipment if you ask. You arrive at the beach. They ask if you'd like shade or sun. They take you to a palapa, if you want shade, as we did. If you are getting too much sun, they will move your chairs, bring umbrellas, whatever you need. They also bring bottled water in an ice bucket for you. You can order drinks, lunch, etc. on the beach and the service is excellent. For lunch, it is very good, and large portions, approx $15 for snacks/tapas and from $18 - $25 for entrees. Throughout your beach day, they will bring wet, towels with ice to use to cool off. I can't emphasize enough how truly friendly and helpful EVERY member of the staff is. They seem to really enjoy making your day perfect. When you go back to your room, there will usually be fresh fruit, wine, or some other little treat. Additionally, as others have said, they stock water (lots of it), a couple Cokes, Diet Cokes, beers, and juices in the fridge, along with ice (all complimentary). There are also plunge pools in the garden rooms that they will heat if you like (watch out, it can get VERY hot). We usually showered or napped and then headed to dinner either on property or went to Playa. The restaurant there is very, very good. Prices are about $8 - $10 for appetizer or salad and about $30 for an entree (approximately). Service there is also excellent. You can eat inside or outside. When you come back to your room, it is usually turned down with a scented oil burning in the room. You can borrow movies to watch on the DVD player. You can exchange books at the main house (or magazines). The iPod in the room is great and loaded with a nice variety of music and piped throughout the bathroom and bedroom. You can also plug your own in. Try to chocolate cake, it is to die for! The Spa My husband did a deep tissue massage and I did the special Earth, Water, Fire (something like that) ritual. Very good, loved the herbs and scents used. The Weather For our week, it was in the mid 80s all week with a great breeze. One night I needed a sweater at dinner. It rained on evening (30 minutes) and one afternoon (1 hour) where we just read on our balcony on the daybed and enjoyed watching the rain. Other Restaurants We ate at Al Cielo next door. Very good. My favorite was the scallops wrapped in bacon in passion fruit. I highly recommend this place. We walked over one evening. Great service too. I think if you were on a budget, this would be a fabulous place to stay (they have 4 rooms). Same gorgeous beach as Esencia. Not the same service and atmosphere, but still very rustic and nice. We ate at Yaxchte, a Mayan restaurant in Playa - very, very good. We at at La Parilla, Mexican in Playa - also very good. We had a beer at a nice little beach bar at Hotel Fusion. The hotel didn't look luxury, but the beach bar was very nice and laid back. Bugs and other annoyances Yes, there are bugs here. It's the jungle. I'm a mosquito magnet and did get 2 or 3 bites. I simply wore bug spray (the one they provided called bye bye and Buzz Away (a natural one I'd brought) and they pretty much left me alone. They are out in the morning, at night, pretty much anytime. So, if you tend to get bit, spray yourself! We didn't have any problems with bugs in the shower or on our fruit as others have talked about. We simply got rid of fruit if it was going bad or put it in baggies (good to bring for lots of reasons). If you haven't been to Playa, I found the sales people a bit annoying, yelling for you to come in and some kind of stalking you in the shops. We still thoroughly enjoyed going there and went 2 days into town. Just say no, gracias a lot. I would recommend this trip to anyone looking for a luxury vacation in a serene, private setting. This would be a fabulous honeymoon spot. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect beach”
Reviews.Author: roxo56
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have stayed at several wonderful small luxury resorts over the years and we rely heavily upon tripadvisor reviews for direction. This trip was our 30th anniversary and we considered many options in planning it. Therefore, it's only right that I relate our experiences for others. 60 miles south of the Cancun airport lies the sleepy beach area Xpu-ha. Esencia is without doubt the most hospitable and best staffed resort we've ever stayed at. Better than Casa que Canta in Zihuatenejo and better than Casa de los Sueños or Villa Rolandi on Isla Mujeres. Here's what makes Esencia better than the others, including the other two SLH members . The Beach, the personal service, solitude-ambience & rooms in that order. The food is excellent also. We only ate in for dinner one night, and the meal was superb. Their very skilled and friendly chef is from Chile and he takes great pride in his menu. He's a fantastic chef. The beach is narrow (50' wide), deserted, peaceful and kept spotless. No beach hawkers in sight. Ask for a mask and flippers because 100 yards off shore there's a healthy little rock and coral reef in 6 feet of water well worth snorkeling ! Personal snorkels come with the room so there's no sharing necessary. Beach service is without par. Fresh dry towels are constantly being offered and changed out on your beach lounge even if you don't ask. They won't let you move anything by yourself. It's as if they're intuitive. In fact, as I write this, little "Miguel" just brought us fresh iced hand towels for our faces, wow ! No plastic cups at the beach, ever. Glass and porcelain, with cloth napkins. BTW, while we were there they were rebuilding the timber and cheesecloth palapas and replaceing them with palm thatch roof ones. Also, one of the pools was also being resurfaced . Don't worry, there's never any construction noise permitted and there was never anyone in the other pool anyway. The breakfast and lunch staff is equally skilled and attentive, but not overly so. Before breakfast, at 7:00 am promptly ,coffee and rolls arrive at your terrace. The ipod full of music they issue you has a wide variety of music and plugs into an amp in the room for a nice touch. They supplied me with earbuds for beach use upon request. The shower stalls are open air which is typically Mexican and they have dbl. heads. I especially liked the overhead pancake rainhead. My wife did the "full tilt" spa session. Called Earth, wind & fire or something like that. She love it ! I chartered a scuba resort dive through the concierge. Diego, their Argentinean dive master was the best I've ever used anywhere, period ! Is Esencia perfect ? No. One very small item, out of their hands is the road noise from the newly expanded highway 307. Usually it cannot be heard from the beach. Some of the garden view rooms, especially those closest to the highway (like ours) can occasionally hear the din. My solution was to keep my room fan and AC cranked at night and then I couldn't hear it. Or, I had the ipod going. It really made a difference which way the wind was blowing as well . That's the ONLY negative thing I can find and it's VERY minor. See how spoiled they make you after only 1 week ? Will we return ? Absolutely ! We can't wait. We've found the very best.

Reviews.Title: “my most relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: lacondessa
Reviews.Content: as soon as I arrived I was treated as though I were a guest of the Dutchess. This is the most relaxing 4 days I have spent in a very long time. From the wonderful coffee and pastries left in the morning for when you awake, to the best spa I have experienced in a very long time, so much that I treated myself to a massage or body treatment every day, make sure that you ask for Angelica or Gerardo, they are the best. My favorite of the 4 was the four element massage. The rooms are huge and decorated in a simple yet elegant manner. The bathroom has everything you need from a rainshower to a tub. My plunge pool was a favorite in the early morning or late afternoon. The wine selection at this hotel is fabulous, including great malbecs from Argentina, and the green ceviche is to die for! The beach is like a postcard, with the private lounge areas for 2. Overall the staff at this hotel is thinking ahead of you on what you want and desire, I never had to ask for anything. And if you like nature, you can befriend the hotels mapaches, the local raccon looking animal that likes to roam around the property. Highly recommend that you experince this wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico! C'est Magnifique! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ingasito
Reviews.Content: In any language, might be the best trip I have ever taken! What an experience! Everything from an hour-long aloe vera spa treatment to perfectly manicured grounds (with interesting iguanas and gorgeous flowers) to excellent, individualized service with out-of-this-world cuisine. It was an experience I will never forget and hope to return soon! Thank you to everyone at Escencia (both vacationers and staff) for making my experience so peaceful and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nctraveler52
Reviews.Content: Few words can describe the incredible experience we had at Esencia. Our family, which includes our eleven and sixteen year old daughters, stayed there for 5 days in early June. The staff was amazing and truly made us feel like royalty. Our every need and desire was catered to. (Nacho, thanks for the cookies and sandwiches and the special meals for the girls at night. Also the CD was amazing) The beach was just plain gorgeous. It was nice having the whole beach to ourselves. Our girls loved the spa. Especially the chocolate massage for the youngest. Mom enjoyed the relaxing hot stone massage and steam room at night. The rooms were simple but beautiful. We LOVED breakfast. We also loved the coffee and pastries on the porch every morning. The food in the restaurant was the best we had on our trip. I would highly recomend Dolphin Discovery at Puerto Adventura and a cenote swim with Lucas and Nacho. The staff will gladly arrange any of these adventures. Esencia was not only fun, but offered a relaxing and peaceful visit. Thank you Esencia for the perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel during the second week of May for three evenings. I cannot say enough about how amazing Esencia was. We enjoy staying at several different properties during our vacations and this was the first of three and by far, the best. We enjoy staying at small hotels versus large properties. I've stayed at several other of the small luxury hotel properties (I forget the web address) and would compare it to the other favorite - Hotel Hana in Maui. From the moment you arrive, the service is terrific. We were escorted to our room (one of the garden suites outside of the main house) and given a tour of the property. Our room was minimal but perfect - all decor white, extremely comfortable bed, beautiful bathtub - large enough for two (plus an outdoor cool tub and outdoor shower), flat panel tv, great ammenities like Molton Brown products and bug spray (thank you!). To be honest, my only complaint is that the shower (in its own room) has slats on the bottom allowing for a bit of a buggy problem. I have to say that I am terrified of bugs - a bit of a wimp admittedly, most people will not care at all. Definitely use the bug spray provided and if you afraid of bugs at the bottom of the shower - just wear the flip-flops so nicely provided. We were lucky enough to visit during off-season and felt like we had the entire property to ourselves practically. Although I think even when it is booked to capacity, it will not feel like it. The sense of privacy is amazing. The pools were absolutely stunning. The restuarant is decent - standard hotel food. We walked up the beach to a few of the surrounding properties. There is an excellent little cafe (believe the owner may have been German if I recall correctly) and it was good food, great atmosphere, a nice change from hotel food. The service was excellent in the Esencia restaurant just thought the food could use a little flavor. **You should note that breakfast is included with your rate. We were under the impression that it was just the coffee left at your door - no, be sure to go and get breakfast - it is included. They should be more clear on this. We figured it out too late.**** I really cannot say enough about what a wonderful, charming property this is. It is well worth every penny. Definitely visit if you would like a very relaxed, low-key vacation in a beautiful and private atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Improved and room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: cest243
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Esencia twice before in 2006 before returning this May. And twice before I was somewhat disappointed with the service and general organization. I went back simply because I was too lazy to find another hotel in the vicinity and I am glad I did. The service has improved; the grounds and beach are impeccable. It is peaceful and quiet. My suggestion to the hotel would be to pay more attention to the maintenance of the rooms; it is no fun having to call the concierge consistently due to non-working TV, DVD, CD players, rusty or broken window and/or shutter openings, dead Internet connections, non-working locks and on and on. My suggestion to fellow travelers is to check your room when you check in so that you don’t have problems later on after you have, as they say, gotten in the groove.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lynnie0429
Reviews.Content: I had done plenty of research before booking this trip as it was a surprise 40th b-day present for my boyfriend and I wanted it to be perfect- to say the least we were both elated and amazed by the property and staff at Esencia!! I'll break it down so it will be easier to follow.... Arrival- after an hour and 15min. car ride from the cancun airport, we came to Esencia.....when you drive up you have no idea where this hotel is located as there is no welcome sign and then you take a drive down a bumpy unpaved road going thorugh the jungle- the mystery of this location was exciting in itself. once you reach a thatched roof buiding you realize you are here, but have no idea what to expect next. we were welcomed warmly and made to feel right at home. Monica and Emily gave us a tour of the property and we were just amazed, it is surrounded by lush gardens and felt very secluded and romantic. The Hotel Room- there are two choices when booking at Esencia, The main House or The Garden view rooms. I would think either would be nice, but because we wanted an oceanview we chose the main house, our room was called Las Terraces and it was well appointed, great view of the ocean and pools. Very simple furnishings but an elegant feel and the most comfortable bed with very high quality linens. Our room was quite large with another room that had a shower(double rain shower heads) and toilet and then a space with double sinks as well. We had a great flat screen tv and loved the Ipod hook ups as well. When we got to our room there was also a nice bottle of wine and a fruit basket that was replenished on a daily basis. The Food-Every morning we had a tray placed outside of our door with coffee and tea, when you arrive they ask you what you like in the morning and there it is waiting for you when you get up, we would have our drinks early and then by 10am we would be ready for breakfast. You also get a full breakfast and there is a choice of anything you could want American or Mexican, we loved the French Toast!! The restaurant offers food all day and can be served at the beach as well, we did not have one bad meal while we were there- the food is excellent. Beach-We have traveled to many islands and other resorts in Mexico, but we felt that this was the most beautiful beach ever. The water is turquoise Blue, the sand soft and white and there are times when you feel like the only one there!! Special Services- We booked the Essence of Love Package so that we had some things included and I thought it was well worth it. With that we had transfers from the airport, a couples massage that was an experience in itself- highly suggested!! a romantic dinner for two which we had on the beach one night and a picnic lunch which we took with us on a snorkeling trip one day. Playa Del Carmen-We decided as much as we loved being at Esencia, we also wanted to get out and explore the near by town a couple of nights for some local culture and dining. We felt it was worth the $30.00 round trip cab ride!! We shopped and ate at a couple of really good restaurants. Then when we came back to Esencia we felt we were back in our own little cozy hideaway. Overall- The staff and hotel are amazing, we felt special each day when we were greeted by first name and as good as the service was, we never felt like it was overwhelming. Esencia holds a very special place in our hearts, we suggest it for couples looking for a romantic holiday or a celebration of some kind. Although there were some children that looked like they were having fun, it seems to be more of a quiet calm place that you go to just get away from it all. If you are thinking about it, please go- you won't be disappointed and say hi from Lynn & Stuart!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, unique Hotel - 4 and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelMavens
Reviews.Content: We used Tripadvisor extensively when booking this hotel, so it's only fair that we write a review. The high level summary is that we really enjoyed Esencia and would enthusiastically recommend it for travelers in search of a one-off property with unique rooms, great beach, lovely grounds and pleasant staff. We first looked at Esencia online and picked it from other area hotels like Deseo and Ikal del Mar. The main driver was the fact that Esencia seemed to have the best beach (it certainly did not disappoint in this regard). We looked online at room prices and then called them directly to see if we could get a deal. At first they quoted us the same price as online, but then when I asked if there was anything they could do like include a spa package, they said they would call us back. When they did, they quoted a package that was significantly less than originally quoted, plus inlcuded 4 spa treatments, daily breakfast and round trip transportation from Cancun. So it seemed like calling the hotel directly was worth it. When we arrived at the Cancun airport we had a little trouble finding our driver, as the sign the service held was very small and in a sea of other drivers. As soon as some of the others figure you are lost, they descend upon you to try to sell their services. Finally we found the person holding our sign, and he called the driver who came in about five minutes in a nondescript minivan. Esencia clearly outsources this, as our driver (who was friendly) was making his first trip to the hotel. We arrived about 6:30PM and were met at the reception area near the front gate. A pleasant American woman gave us a tour of the grounds and walked us to our room, the Rosa suite in the main house. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the terrace of this suite, which overlooked the pool and ocean beyond. In general Esencia is made up of several white buildings with Spanish roof tiles. The look feels almost like something you would see in Morrocco or Sanrtorini and is very minimalist, yet comfortable. Our room had a large comfortable king size bed, daybed by the window, desk, bathroom with double sink, walk in closet, huge two head shower and soaking tub. Some others have commented on ants. We did see very, very tiny ants in the closet. These were plentiful but somehow did not really seem like a nuisance; just be sure to give your clothes a shake before putting them on. We also saw a small gekko in our room on several occasions. He was easily frightened when approached. I really like the fact that you can plug your iPod into the in wall sound system. Keep in mind that this won't charge your iPod, so best advised to bring a power source. At check in and periodically during our stay they bring a huge fruit basket to the room. The fridge is always stocked with two beers and a handful of cokes, water and juices - nice touch. I would rate this room on par with other high end hotels we have stayed at, like Post Ranch or Korakia. As others have commented, the restaurant on the property is pretty much your only dinner option. We liked the fact that you can sit outside. For our first meal, we each ordered an appetizer and main course. This proved to be WAY too much food, as their portions are huge! For subsequent dinners we sometimes ordered just two appetizers, or split an entree with an appetizer. At first we thought the food was just okay, but after several meals (and especially compared with restaurants in Playa del Carmen) the food is very good. We liked the crepes, the sopecitos and lobster taquitos as appetizers. Both soups (lime and corn) are excellent and must haves. For entrees we liked the beef filet, lamb (TWO racks on the plate) and seafood risotto. The coconut pie was the best dessert. At lunch we had the ceviches, which are excellent. Again, one is perfect for splitting between two people. The guacamole and chips and salsa were too good to resist. It would have been nice for them to serve the lunch menu at dinner just to mix it up a bit. While they don't advertise this, another couple told us they ordered hamburgers in their room one night for dinner. The breakfast menu is quite extensive; everything from granola to pancakes to Yucatecan specialties. The Huevos con chorizo, epazotes and machacdo are all worth trying. The breakfast menu has prices listed on it. I found this strange as everyone we talked to was on a package that had breakfast included. They do bring you coffee and rolls to your room in the morning (although they missed us the first day). As others have commented, if you don't fetch these quickly the birds and ants will have their way with them. It's funny that this still persists, as it seems like a cheap food cover would solve the problem. The beach at Esencia is great for sunning. The sand is very soft and powdery. There are 11 little beach palapas with two chaises in them. Even if you don't get there early enough to snag one, the staff will gladly bring two chaises down from the pool to set wherever you'd like. We actually preferred being out in the sun and closer to the water. The beach is crescent shaped and about a mile long. To the left of Esencia is a short stretch of deserted beach that leads to the Xpuha Palace, a resort that has been vacant since Wilma. To the right is a longer stretch where you pass some all inclusive resorts. Immediately next to Esencia is Al Cielo, which is a restaurant with four hotel rooms and some beach palapas. I found XpuHa beach to be more populated than I expected. Esencia however enjoys its location at one end of the beach, so you really didn't get much traffic in front of the property. Typically when you did, the people looked at Esencia as if to say "I wish I were staying there!". The beach staff is super friendly, especially Julio, who seems to be the major-domo of the staff. They come by with bottled water and cool towels, and will bring you margaritas (try the Kiwi margs) from the bar without making you feel like you are being harrassed. They were so helpful we felt it appropriate to give them an additional gratuity at the end of our stay. The beach itself has some coral right in front if it, so if you are looking for a sandy swimming beach this really isn't it. The snorkeling right in front of the hotel is not great, but there is good stuff nearby. We took the complimentary 9AM yoga class most days. There was a great female teacher for a few of the days (forget her name) and one male teacher who was not so good. I did not take any of the spa treatments (except for a steam) but I have it on good authority that they are excellent, particularly the earth water fire and air massage. We did the temezcal (sweat lodge) one night. While it was a good experience and we liked our guide Eliu, it wasn't the mind bending experience I was hoping for. The swim right after felt great. To sum up, we really liked Esencia and would go back, if we didn't have so many other places to visit first. We were a little nervous that it wasn't going to live up to our expectations, but it more than did. If you are looking for a unique, beautfully landscaped hotel with a great beach and interesting architecture, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Esencia - a great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: peterm1
Reviews.Content: I would echo many of the positive reviews posted here. My wife and I just returned from a seven night stay at the Esencia. When you arrive (after an hour car trip from Cancun airport), you are greeted at a traditional Mayan hut, and then taken by bicycle cart down a long winding path to the hotel (the path reminded me of Survivor at night with all of the lit torches lining the way). We were greeted by Monica and Nicholas (who are both extremely friendly), and Nicholas gave us a short tour of the property. THE ROOM: We stayed in a garden room suite on the bottom floor. While we did not have a view, I didn't mind looking out into the jungle, since the property was maintained meticulously. We had a plunge pool (and outdoor shower), which was quite warm and I enjoyed sitting in it at the end of a day. I won't repeat the description of the rooms in detail that other people have posted, since I think they all have similar amenities, which are modern and luxurious. The bed was very comfortable and large, and it was great being able to plug our Ipod in and have music playing in the bedroom and bathroom. I also liked the refrigerator with free water, soda and beer all week. We watched a few movies on our large TV, and they have a selection of DVDs in the main office (no rental charge). They also have a small selection of used books and magazines in the main house in one of the side rooms, and I would suggest that they let guests know about this and perhaps suggest that people may wish to leave books they are finished with (we left ours). It would be nice if they subscribed to some magazines that people could borrow (just about all of the magazines I saw were foreign fashion magazines). Back to the room. I was concerned about bugs since I really don't like them and had read one review that concerned me. However, it was not a problem. There were some tiny ants that came into our bathroom one day and they quickly sprayed them which put an end to the problem, and if you leave any food out you will probably get ants so keep food packed or in the fridge. Also, one day I woke up and found what looked like a very small scorpion by the bed on the floor just sitting there, and quickly put a bowl over it and they came and removed it. I was told it was not a poisonous type of bug and I didn't really worry about it (I got the sense they were surprised it was there and I never heard anyone else mention anything about seeing scorpions). After all, the room is in the jungle and I think it would be impossible to keep all bugs out all the time unless the place was hermetically sealed. Believe me, I can't stand bugs, so unless you are totally phobic about bugs, I wouldn't let this keep you from going there. We also saw a Tapir outside eating some fruit, which was interesting. Two other things my wife noticed - she said she smelled a sewage smell in the bathroom sometimes, although I didn't notice it (she has a very good sense of smell). She also noticed that the chambermaid would leave our door unlocked when she straightened up our room in the evenings. I wasn't concerned about security at all when I was there, but I did keep valuables in the in-room safe just in case. It was only about a 30 second walk to the restaurant and main house and a minute walk to the beach so the location was great (the property isn't huge so it's easy to walk around). We would usually wake up early in the morning from birds calling in the nearby trees, which I didn't mind since I liked getting up fairly early. SERVICE: The best we have ever experienced. The best thing in my mind about the Esencia is the service - never have we met such friendly staff at a hotel. They aren't intrusive, but are happy to talk if you want to and are always there to help out with anything you need. We thought Elias and Fidel at the restaurant, and the person at the beach area with the hat (I forget his name) were especially nice, but everyone was great. FOOD: Expensive but tasty I loved having tea and coffee dropped off automatically every morning on our patio so I could relax in my PJs in private with my coffee and pastries. The larger breakfast by the pool area was also excellent, especially the huevos con chorizo (eggs with sausage) and french toast. I would also ask for "liquados" or smoothies and they were happy to make them (these meals were included in our rate). The lunch menu was also very good, and my wife loved the shrimp ceviche. We had dinner there on three nights, and it was always very good and the setting was nice, although it would have been nice if they changed the menu some nights during the week (they did have daily specials). The last night we were there, they had a special barbeque dinner with free mojitos and margaritas on the beach around a campfire, with an excellent mariachi band. They served an amazing Tres Leches cake for dessert too. For a little variety we ate once next door at Al Cielo (you have to make reservations in advance and the food was good but not great), and we went into Playa del Carmen and ate at Ula Gula (an excellent Italian restuarant) and Babe's Noodle House (which has good, cheap Thai food and large drinks). A taxi into Playa cost about $16 on average. The hotel can give you a list of recommended restaurants in Playa too. One suggestion I have is to also automatically give each guest a list of tours and activities - I saw that someone had a binder with such materials from the hotel and assume you can get one by asking but it would have been nice to have one in the room already. One suggestion I would make is to keep the bar at the pool area open in the evening and play some music - it would have been nice to hang out there either before or after dinner. BEACH: Just about perfect. Esencia sits on the north end of X-PU HA beach, and it's nearly deserted except for a few people who walk up this far for a stroll. The sand is soft, and the water very clear and warm. If you walk about 100 yards to the left or right, there will be large sandy areas to swim around in (the reef comes in closer to the shore in front of the hotel). I went snorkeling just north of the hotel and saw a sea turtle and some fish, which was fun (I went on a snorkeling tour later in the week and the visibility was better near the Esencia than the lagoons I went to). One day I arranged for a snorkeling tour with Lucas through the hotel. Since it turned out to be cloudy and cool the morning we were supposed to go, the hotel rescheduled it for the next morning. There must have been some kind of mix-up since the next morning when we went to meet Lucas he said he was not called by the hotel to reschedule the tour, so we couldn't go that day since he was taking some divers out (it turned out to be fine with us anyway since we didn't mind relaxing on the beach). I think the hotel may have confused us with the divers. They have very comfortable lounge chairs under palapas, and if they are all taken they will bring out more chairs and an umbrella for you. Some people came out early to reserve seats by putting their stuff on them, but by early I mean 9 or 10am, not 5am like at some places, and again it's not an issue since they will bring more chairs and umbrellas onto the beach if you want. There are also a lot of empty chairs by both pools - I never saw more than a handful of people hanging out at the pools even though they were very nice (one pool that was heated by the bar was for kids and families and the other was adults only and was cool). Next to the hotel on the beach is Al Cielo, which is beautiful although rustic. Further south are some all-inclusives and some bars and restaurants like Cafe del Mar (not bad for a sandwich for lunch). It's more crowded and dirty there, so I only went there for a long walk or a snack. The X-PU HA Palace hotel is to the north of Esencia, but it is on the next bay over so it does not sit on the same beach as Esencia and we never saw anyone from there. OTHER NICE THINGS: The hotel has a laptop we borrowed to check our emails - there is a wireless network in the main house area. It's free and easy to do. I liked how you don't need any cash at all - they automatically add a 15% service charge for food and drinks so we didn't need to worry about tips (we just left them on our pillow for the chambermaid). You never need to sign a check at meals or for drinks either - they ask your name and just add it to your hotel bill (after a day or two the staff knows your name and don't have to ask anymore). I asked for our bill every few days just to check it and there were no discrepancies (although they don't itemize the food or drinks you have - it will just say "restaurant" and then the date). We had to send out some t-shirts and underwear for laundry one day since we ran out, and were pleased to discover the charge was very reasonable, unlike at some hotels. We also liked the free yoga lessons given at the main house at 9am. They have free yoga (and sometimes Tai-Chi) lessons there every morning, which is a great service. They also have a free tea service at the main house at 5pm, which was also very nice. Overall, we had a great trip and I would definitely stay there again. I liked the location, too, since you could go to Playa without much trouble, and a lot of other attractions were close to the hotel, such as several cenotes to swim in across the street (we went to Azul - very nice), and Xcaret and Tulum were not too far away by car (we took a great tour called Tulum and Beyond, at www.playa.info). If you need to be closer to the action, or like to have a lot of people around, I would check out Playa, but if you want relaxtion, luxury, privacy and no hassles, Esencia is highly recommended. One final tip: if you want to stay here, join the Club at SLH.com (it's free), and you will be entitled to a few extra freebies such as appetizers and some cocktails, as well as a free room upgrade if it's available (all the rooms were booked when we went so we didn't get an upgrade).

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaNate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights 28. Jan.-2. Feb. at this lovely boutique hotel. We found the hotel on the Small Luxury Hotels website, but booked through their Houston office because SLH told us they were fully booked during the time we requested.That was lucky for us since the hotel itself offered a better package than SHL. The hotel offered a fine package, including a bottle of wine and a fruit bowl served in our room when we arrived, one complimentary evening dinner in the restaurant with our choice of anything on the menu accompanied by a bottle of good champagne, a couple's massage for 2 in the tranquil Mayan-themed spa, an ocean-view room (ours was in the ground floor in the "guest house"- it was fantastic with its unique architecture, 2 full bathrooms, large patio overlooking the grassy lawn and sea with a hammock and daybed), a picnic lunch and full breakfast every day, preceded by a "pre-breakfast" of sweet rolls and beverage of choice served on your patio . This was in addition to the hotel's keeping the refrigerator stocked with bottled water and soft drinks of your choice, as well as offering the same 2 items on the beach and by the pool at the guest's request - all complimentary. From the moment we were greeted by the hotel's driver at the airport and whisked away to the resort in a comfortable car to our arrival at the hotel's Mayan house at the entrance, everything was done to make our brief holiday at Escencia an enchanting experience. The hotel grounds are beautiful, like being in a mini-rainforest, and they lead to expanses of green lawn and palm trees leading to 2 large swimmming pool and a beach-side restaurant , which border on a crescent of white sand and turquoise water. On the beach are a sufficient number of Mayan-type palapas enclosing 2 comfortable lounges protected from the sun by sheer gauze curtains on 3 sides. Beach & pool attendants are constantly offering water, cool towels and drinks. The hotel assisted us in renting a car for 2 days, so we could make the easy trips to the ruins at Tulum and Playa del Carmen. The food at the restaurant was so good that we ate there every night, unusual for my husband who normally likes to eat any place but at a hotel. The folks at the hotel will assist guests in making reservations at other restaurants, though, and there is a restaurant at the small hotel next door. My husband and I are retired, and we enjoyed the mix of guests which included young & middle-aged couples, as well as 2 families with small children. The atmosphere is unpretentious and quietly elegant. The management and staff are friendly and helpful and always willing to do anything to make their guests' stays comfortable and enjoyable. We like to snorkel, and to our happy surprise, we found there is really good snorkeling right off the beach of the hotel. The sandy bottom in the water off the beach makes it very easy to swim too. There is no real "happy hour" or night-life scene at Esencia. By 10:30 guests have usually left the restaurant, and all is quiet. If one wants night-time entertainment, it can be found in Playa del Carmen which is a short drive away. We usually had a drink or 2 delivered to our room after dinner, and played cards on our patio while enjoying the sound of the surf and the starry sky. The manager of the hotel is always around, and she spends time with the guests, eager to hear comments and suggestions. The management staff and the waiters get to know the guests by name; guests feel as though they are welcome houseguests, not anonymous hotel patrons. All daytime meals and snacks (including tea time) can be enjoyed at many places on the property, and guests never have to "sign" for anything. We have lived in many countries and cities around the world and visited many more, and we found the Esencia to be one of the best tropical/beach hotels ever, in its location, service, rooms, public areas, food, Mayan atmosphere, amenities, and especially its attitude. You will find casual modern elegance with a tropical twist at Esencia. It's great!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Experience”
Reviews.Author: CSAL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a memorable long weekend at this spectacular hotel. Having stayed at such well regarded carribean resorts as malliouhana in anguilla and le toiny in st barth's (as well as numerous four seasons, aman, and relais & chateau properties around the world), we arrived with high expectations and a quick need for relaxation. The staff of Esencia wasted no time in fulfilling our needs. Upon arrival in our beautiful room in le torre, high atop what is rumored to be an italian duchesses' house, two of the obligating staff uncorked a bottle of argentinian malbec, showed us how to turn on the esencia playlist on our room's ipod, and walked us through our complimentary mini bar. After they left, we celebrated our arrival with incomparable views of what may be the best beach in the riviera maya and incomparably well manicured grounds, to surround-sound latin tunes and the best love songs from bollywoood. We have a soft spot for regional cuisine, and when our lime soup, handmade corn tortillas, and duck mole arrived at dinner, we understood why the hotel's chilean chef had been written up in several noteworthy food oriented publications on both sides of the atlantic. Other reviewers who have commented that the nightlife here is subdued may have missed the small spirited after dinner scene out on the terrasse. Here, against the backdrop of torches and stars, staff members run to get the tres leches cake you forgot to order at the restaurant while you chat with the hotel's gracious general manager, or another guest from the U.S. or europe. Conversation invariably turned to the oh, so glamorous female movie star who was among the guests this weekend, but the staff would quickly point out (before asking if the tequilla in the margarita was just right) that this happens often, and all their guests deserve star treatment. The natural setting at esencia was beautiful, food delicious, and accomodations luxurious, but we are writing this review because the staff at this very special property couldn't have done more to make us feel like we were priveleged family members of that rumored itialian duchess.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: BeachbumsVirginia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Hotel Esencia as an anniversary gift to ourselves. We had a wonderful time. The grounds at the hotel are beautiful as is the beach. We stayed in the "Minta" garden suite which is about 50 yards from the main building. We thought the suite was great. Breakfast served on the deck in the morning, a fridge stocked w/ water and beer each day. The room had a really comfortable bed, a sound system hooked to your own personal ipod, a flat screen TV and a large, well-appointed bathroom. There was also a plunge pool off the side of the suite that was also very nice. Other reviewers have mentioned bugs in their rooms but we didn't experience that at all. The people that work at the resort are very nice everywhere on the resort and they try very hard to please. They do make mistakes, however, and the service is not the same as in the States. Double check on all spa appointments, taxi pick up times, etc. The service on the beach is fantastic. The restaurant is solid, not great. The wine list is fine but most of the selections are not available. The restaurant is also quite expensive and its the only one on the property. Its worth the $34 round trip taxi fare to go to Playa del Carmen one night just to mix it up. Hotel Esencia is a great place to go if you are really just looking to relax (we were). There is no nightlife there. The hotel is also very expensive but all the upscale boutique resorts in that area are the same way. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach!”
Reviews.Author: OregonSungirl
Reviews.Content: Room: We booked an ocean front room (Arbor) in the main house. Upon checking in, I looked out the doors, across the lawn, through some bushes, over the pool, through another set of bushes, and was able to glimpse the ocean - looking to the right of the outdoor massage station directly in front of our room. This to me, is not ocean view - the most important aspect of booking our room. In addition, the view from the bay window (along the side) looked out upon bushes and a chain-link fence that was attempting to cover the vacant lot next door.The rest of our room was large with a simple elegance. Bathroom was fine, nothing fancy, but the amenities were poor. Our room included a flat screen t.v. but we never turned it on and an IPOD stereo set up. Our patio was very spacious with a chase, built-in sofa, table and chairs, and hammock. Coffee was provided every morning on our patio without disturbing us. Grounds: The grounds were extremely well kept and beautiful but the size of the property is not as described. There is a small hotel directly abutting the west side and an empty lot with a lot of local foot traffic within 10 feet of the other side of the main house where our room was. Away from the beach is a lush and well-laid out garden setting. Beach: Beautiful! The beach is kept clean and there is a very gradual slope into the water. Seaweed in spots but not intrusive to swimming. The lounge chairs are comfy and secluded in cabana style structures to allow for a little privacy. The best beach service we have ever received! Staff set up the chairs of our choice and made regular rounds to check on us, offering buckets of ice with water and iced towels for freshening. Towels were plentiful and a staff person was always standing on call for anything one might need. The lack of any form of toys was the only drawback. Kayaks, kick boards, windsurfing boards, all enjoyed by the other resorts, were not available. If there was a beach activity person we never encountered him. We did see some people snorkeling but it did not appear to be the best place for it. Foot traffic was not as imposing as one might expect from the larger resorts, even though the beach is only about 1 mile long. We did not see a single cruise ship nor do they dock in the vicinity. Nothing ruins an ocean view like one of those monstrosities! Noise: Beyond the empty lot must be a gigantic hotel. Throughout the day from our patio we were subjected to voices coming over a bull horn or a selection of bad music. One can also actually hear road noise from the patio and the occasional siren. This particular room is a short distance from the reception area and the stucco lends to magnified acoustics. Bugs: I have traveled the tropics extensively and am well aware that with it comes bugs. BUT, after having my suitcase open for a few hours I found it to be completely infested with these small insects. Throughout the week there were swarms of them throughout the room. A nice fruit basket was awaiting us upon our arrival, but by morning it was so covered with ants that the fruit was no longer identifiable. Of course the ants continued in a long line from the door, to the fruit, and continued their march throughout the room. I had our room fumigated 3 times and finally gave up. I took to spraying them with the insecticide provided for personal use just to keep them under control. Staff: The general staff was extremely friendly, efficient, and quick to meet our needs. The management staff was a complete disaster. Upon arrival, I informed them (not one of the management staff ever offered their names, whereas the general staff did) that we wanted a room with an ocean view as we had booked. She said she would look into what was available and get back to us. We also wanted to know if we could have a coffee maker for our room. 8pm we checked back about the room, unwilling to unpack in case we were able to move. Another person was on duty and we were told that we would be informed first thing in the morning. The coffee maker was a mystery but He would look in to it. 9am no news so I went to the office to find that He (different He) was just looking into it. Request for coffee maker made again. 12pm checked back to find completely different staff and made requests again. 3pm (still haven't unpacked) the manager (another one) will get back to us. FINALLY at 8pm we meet with the manager (yet another one!) to be told that there is a wedding party and it would be too inconvenient to switch (even though they had not arrived yet) and they had no coffee maker but would send a pot of coffee to our room 3 times a day but that never happened. I also just wanted to know if the gym at the Copa was available to us for a fee. It took days to get the answer: yes, for $45 per person. I have never seen such a management team! No communication and always changing. Very frustrating! Even a negative response to our requests would have been preferable to leaving us hanging. (To their credit, on the third day they did provide us with a water pot with a heating element so that we were able to make our own coffee. I also requested non-fat milk for the fridg. in our room and that was provided quickly and at no extra charge.) Water: This is one of the few places that provides its guests with plenty of water without an extra charge! It may sound trivial, but in a hot climate and being ones that do not drink alcohol or soda, this was a very nice amenity that can often times add up $$$ quickly. The refrigerator was also stocked daily instead of the arrival beverages that are never replaced without a fee at other resorts. Food and Restaurant: We are not big eaters so this is not a priority for us. The food was extremely well presented if a little bland or too salty. The breakfast was very nice! We don't normally eat breakfast but throughly enjoyed it every day. The french toast is a must-have! The menu did not change during our 5 nights but a special was offered each evening that did vary. We did not each lunch. Service for dinner was exceptional. The dress code is not noted in the website and upon arrival we were informed it is "casual chic". I did not bring appropriate attire as I was told that is was casual before arriving. (I live in Oregon - we take "casual" seriously.) Though I felt under dressed there were those more so than I. The evenings in January were far chillier than expected so a shawl or sweater is a must have. I only brought an REI jacket and felt quite silly. Room service: Hmmm. Yes, room service is available 24 hours a day if you don't mind paying $5 PLUS 20% of the bill Plus the gratuity of 15% added to every meal beyond the cost of the food. Pastry bites are provided every morning delivered to the room. Literally three bites for two along with coffee - a little skimpy and you must eat it right away or it becomes ant-infested quite quickly. Tea is a formal affair at 5pm. 3pm would be more appropriate but cookies are included with a nice selection of tea. Spa: I only had one service, an aloe massage. 50 minutes for $110 and it was well done in a lovely setting. (This is more reasonable than many places I have visited.) One could also have the massage in-room for a minimal $5(?) fee. Fruit and flowered water (surprisingly yummy) were offered afterward. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The lack of physical activity options is maddening for the person who needs daily exercise. They do offer yoga and tai chi every morning at 9am. I was impressed with the level of skill and the setting was lovely. Usually only one or two people other than myself. I dislike using gyms and would prefer outdoor exercise but because there are no water sports or bikes (no room to ride anyway) a gym would have been a huge benefit. A little sundry shop would be a nice addition for postcards or gift items. The rooms lack the typical postcards and resort info that provides one with an introduction and some familiarity with what is around and available. I would have liked to have learned the story behind the Duchess who previously owned the house and its history. The drive from Cancun airport to the resort took 1 hour and 15 minutes. Overall, the resort needs some fine tuning and additional activities. If going for the beach, make sure you are really getting an ocean view room, but one can't help but be pleased with the beach itself. (Sorry this is so long but I had a request for as many details as possible!)
